Using the camera in "superior auto" mode to photograph my kid's indoor activities has yielded very disappointing quality photos.  The images are grainy, blurry, and when you view pictures in full size people look like they are watercolor or oil paintings -- splotchy and fuzzy around the edges.I have also found that if you have several people sitting together the camera struggles to focus -- almost without fail one or more of the persons comes out blurry.Finally the zoom control is imprecise.  You push the zoom button and nothing happens and then all of a sudden it zooms to the extreme setting.  Quite annoying.Overall I do not recommend this camera.  I wish I could take mine back.

Reviews.Title: Amazing little BEAST!
Reviews.Author: ThatOneDude
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera no doubt. It has so many little effects. Like a soft skin effect where you take a picture and it edits it to make you look flawless. It also has 3 different recording qualities (all being 1080i). If you record on the highest quality you wont be able to save it to a dvd, only to a bluray disk. The Design is very nice. Some people complain on how small it is but I feel it just fine, and my hands are huge. It is a COMPACT camera after all! In the end I highly suggest you buy this. You there... Yes you... The one reading this...Buy it! Don't even think about it. Just do it and you won't be disappointed. Do it! (Just read the product details so you know exactly what your getting, which I guess contradicts my previous statement of "Don't even think about it" but whatever... You know what I mean.)Cheers!-ThatOneDude

Reviews.Title: The best camera i've ever had
Reviews.Author: Newplan
Reviews.Content: i was already impressed with this camera i read its reviews, so i ordered it. When it arrived i took a few shots with it and it was wow! The picture quality is suberb. My best feature is the background defocus feature. If you're looking for a small camera that can do what big cameras do, grap this little cutie fast!

Reviews.Title: PERFECT...  if this is what you're looking for.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a small camera that takes really nice pictures.  Something I can keep in my coat or bag to have at all times.  Bought several others and returned them.  This is the keeper.  The image quality is DECIDEDLY superior to anything else I've tried in the sub-$200 price range.  Also superior to a few more expensive models I've looked at in store.In full daylight, the pictures are sharp as tacks.  In a poorly lit room, the quality does go down a touch, but nothing like any of the other cameras I've tried recently.  With this camera, I usually manage to avoid using the flash when shooting indoors.  Even a reasonably bright room gets excellent sharpness.On the practical side, it's ridiculously small and portable.  Fits in the breast pocket of my windbreaker, would even fit in a pretty small purse I'd imagine too.  Battery life has been excellent as well.  I was shooting pictures of my daughter most of the day today, as well as a few videos (which are GREAT quality, by the way), and barely dented the battery life.This camera is definitely not for someone who wants easy options for manual focus and exposure control.  It's not a dSLR, but that's OK.  A dSLR is not the best choice for every situation.  Sure, they take great photos, but they're bulky and heavy.  They're also HUGE theft targets.  If you want to take pictures of daily life, or when hiking maybe, you don't want big.  What's the point of superior image quality if you always leave it at home or in the car?  I've been pretty into manual photography, but lately, I don't really find myself wanting to take the time to do that. The camera makes most shooting decisions for you, and it does them pretty darned well.  80% of the time the Intelligent mode is fine.  When I have to switch to a scene mode, usually those modes do a great job delivering what they claim to offer.  That's more than many can say.  The handheld twilight mode delivers the best no-flash handheld night shots I've ever seen.  Anti-motion blur really stops most motion blur.Oh, and the digital zoom?  Always been of the impression they are useless.  Not this one.  Combining the 10X optical and 10X digital has produced some excellent shots, and surprisingly sharp at that.  Sure, you could zoom in afterwards in Photoshop, but if you zoom in right then, the camera makes shutter, focus, and aperture decisions for the scene you actually mean to capture.  That may not be true if you go wide and zoom in using Photoshop.  Seriously, try the digital zoom!Overall, best digital camera I've ever owned!

Reviews.Title: Lightning fast very slim point and shoot camera capable of capturing high quality images
Reviews.Author: dlc "dlc"
Reviews.Content: As a point and shoot camera the WX150 is simply phenomenal, it is very slim and small making it super portable to easily take along anywhere. It uses a "BSI" CMOS sensor improving low-light performance and this camera is ultra fast! It starts up very, very quickly and the shutter lag is virtually non-existent, allowing one to quickly capture those precious spontaneous moments. Even with all this performance in an extremely compact camera the image quality is excellent.I recently purchased a Canon SX160 I also reviewed on Amazon that the WX150 cannot match in terms of maximum zoom, 64x vs 20x, and with all the manual controls the Canon has. Although the SX160 is an inferior "point and shoot" camera compared with the WX150, the Canon is much bigger and much slower with very long flash recharge times. I was able to find the WX150 for $149.99 at a B&M; store with the big red and white bulls eye logo.Video is impressive at full HD 1080p with stereo sound which also allows you to capture still photos as you are recording, very nifty! This camera also has a burst mode capable of capturing 10 frames per second and I tried it, and it works. I believe my Canon Rebel XS DSLR is only capable of approx. 3 frames per second.The only potential downside to this camera may be durability as it does feel very plasticky and light, so I do tend to handle this Sony with more care than my other cameras. In comparison the Canon SX160 feels very robust and a metal Sony DSC T99 I have has been very durable.Although the Sony lacks manual controls it has an impressive array of usable custom settings and artistic scene modes. With superior portability and a 10x zoom the Cybershot WX150 is very close to being a perfect point and shoot camera, and did I mention this thing is incredibly fast?UPDATE: I just realized the "Superior Auto" setting on the WX150 uses advanced HDR (High Dynamic Range)technology which very quickly captures multiple images at varying exposure levels of the same subject with a single click of the shutter release button. The camera gathers from the under exposed to the over exposed ends of the images captured then processes them together for a single photo of greater dynamic range, pretty cool for a point and shoot camera!

Reviews.Title: Great all-around camera for novices
Reviews.Author: John E. Heyer
Reviews.Content: While I've generally used point and shoot cameras less and less over the last few years, my girlfriend's HTC Evo was producing too many blurry low-light pictures, so I wanted to get her something to use on vacations and special occasions.  The criteria for the gift was easy to use, nice looking, and under $250 (she didn't want the stress of carrying a $500 camera around).  I initially bought a Fujifilm F660EXR but the pictures were constantly coming out washed out, so I decided to look for alternatives and spotted this model at CostCo.  It seemed to be everything I was looking for, and after reading reviews here, I pulled the trigger. After 3 months of use, I can say I'm overall very happy I returned the Fuji and went with the Sony.Loves:- Simply wonderful pictures.  Images are sharp and true to color.  It generally does a great job with skin tones and bright colors- Low light pictures come out well with no need for adjustments or use of strobe flash.  This is the part that truly amazes me every time- Panaromic feature works nicely and is a breeze to use- HD Movies are easily shot with the push of one button and come out sharp with stereo sound- Camera automatically turns off to preserve battery- Charges via USB cable, so no need to lug battery charger around- Uses standard SDHC memory cards.  No more Sony Proprietary "MemStick" adapters needed.- Clock allows for setting of "Home" and "Destination" time zones, letting you easily change to a different time zone when travellingSo-Sos:- Battery life is just OK.  Generally speaking it's good for a few hours of picture taking.  Shooting video drops the battery life significantly.- Size of the body is a bit small.  It's fine for women with small hands, but folks with large hands may find it easy to drop.  I'd recommend investing in a wrist strap, which inexplicably is not included- Direct video output is only via HDMI, with no cable or adapter includedGripes:- By default, movies are taken in AVCHD format ("MPO" file extension).  This format is not supported by Windows Media Player, YouTube, etc. so you'll need to download the "PlayMemories" program from Sony to get them converted.  I preferred to use MP4 format for videos, which is easily configured in the camera settings.- No waterproof housing available. It's a shame, because I would love to take this on a dive.  I've been using a Panasonic Lumix TS20 for underwater pictures and it's worked OK, but the Sony took better pictures hands down.Overall, very pleased with the camera and think you'll be hard-pressed to find a better one under $200.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: blueskysthunder
Reviews.Content: The little camera is great... Pic's are wonderful on the auto settings and if you want to change things up there are many manual setting to take pic's your way. I've had this Sony for a month now and it's the best little camera in it's class, fast shutter, clear pic's. Uses SD cards which are very easy to find and cheap. You won't be sorry purchasing one of these.

Reviews.Title: It's Fast!
Reviews.Author: Robert Tennant
Reviews.Content: I looked a the product specs on a lot of "point & shoot" cameras before I bought this particular model. My highest priority on choosing a new camera was the delay time between pushing the button and actually taking the picture. In good lighting the specs & other reviewers said it was almost instant, and it IS!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Blindfury
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about 6 weeks.  So far it has done well.  I was surprised by how much I like having the extra zoom.  My last digital camera only had a 3x zoom.A few things concern me...1) Sometimes there is a little distortion in the photo near the bottom corners.  Usually this is not noticeable unless a face is captured in this area of the frame.2) The toggle for the wide/zoom is a bit slow to react.  It takes a second or two before the lens moves after pressing the toggle switch.3) It is definitely a fragile feeling camera.  I don't fault it for this, but it is something to be aware of.Other than these concerns I still think it is a good camera so far.  I am enjoying the extra zoom that it offers, especially in this compact body design.  I consider this camera to be a great deal if you can get it for around $200.  I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: jeffs3g
Reviews.Content: I've owned the DSLR's, and even tried a "bridge" camera (or mega zoom), but the camera I always take with me is my older Cannon SD750 "point and shoot". Now it's time to look at cameras again, and after reading many reviews from all over I decided on this Sony WX150. Reasons for me where simple, I want to take the picture, not do calculations. I have kids, and I have animals, these are difficult to take pictures of for a lot of cameras without blurry images. Here is where this Sony Cyber Shot excels, in fact I have tested this camera in different lighting conditions, kids running around, taking the usually impossible pictures of the cat and dog and they have turned out great. I had a little difficulty with the panoramic mode at first, but it was because I was moving the camera too slow. Video quality is much better than I expected from a point and shoot, video is smooth and sound is decent. I would say this is everything I was hoping for in a small easy to take along package.

Reviews.Title: very nice small camera
Reviews.Author: Alexandre
Reviews.Content: What I like:- good 10x zoom- robust metal body- small- right weight : stays well in hand while being light enough for being in pocket- nice options : blur photo background, take several pictures to avoid having overexposed parts on the picture, soften skin on portraits- very good video mode- fastWhat I don't like (compared to my old canon ixus 860)- pictures are not as crisp- battery latch seems fragile- macro minimal length is bigger +/- 5 cm- you have to have a fast computer to see the high quality videos without lagBottom line :- Ratio price vs features very good

Reviews.Title: Happy With This Camera
Reviews.Author: Roe
Reviews.Content: Had Sony cameras in the past and always impressed with the Carl Zeiss lenses.  I needed a smaller, more light weight camera and had purchased the WX650 but was unhappy with the quality of its Carl Zeiss lens, the slow focus, the 5X zoom and overly complicated menu system. However, took a chance on the WX150 with Sony G lens and 10X zoom which is just as small and light weight as the WX650.  I was pleasantly surprised at the speedier focusing of the WX150 as well as the the photo quality of the G lens, the 10X zoom and the more intuitive menu system.  In addition, the video quality on this camera is outstanding. For a camera of its size and weight, which easily fits in a pocket, it performs very well.

Reviews.Title: Much like my favorite old Canon SD750
Reviews.Author: C. Hall
Reviews.Content: First, I should start with what kind of photographer I am: I just want to pick up a camera, turn it on and have it take decent pictures quickly.  I have a toddler, so I don't have time to mess with settings, and I need a camera that focuses and takes a photo FAST.My favorite, favorite, favorite camera was my old Canon sd750.  I rarely took it out of auto mode, and 95% of the photos I took came out great.  That's close enough for me.  I didn't even think about the camera, because it worked every time and was frustration free.I 'upgraded' to a Canon sd4500 in 2010.  Hated it. While it was a more advanced camera, it was slow, which meant that I could only use 20% of the photos I took of my toddler as the rest were a blur, because the auto settings 'thought' about things too much and I missed photo ops from a wiggly toddler.  I avoided taking pictures because I hated that thing so much.This Sony is as close as I've found to the old SD750.  Similar layout, size and it's quick and easy and hassle free. Just what I was looking for.This isn't the camera for you if you want to mess with a lot of features.  It's designed to be idiot proof and a true 'point and shoot'.The quality is also on par with the old Canon.  It seems to be well made and sturdy enough that it might survive a fall (though I certainly don't want to test that).I'm not used to how Sony set up their menus, but it was intuitive enough for me to figure out everything I wanted to do without the manual (mostly to turn off the obnoxious navigation beeping.)The auto focus settings work great and the vast majority of the photos I've taken have turned out wonderfully.  If I lost this one, I wouldn't even shop around, I'd just get this again.My only caveat would be that this camera is small.  That's fine for me, as I'm a woman and I have pretty small hands, but I could see it being hard to use/hold for someone with larger hands.Perfect point and shoot for someone with smaller hands looking for an idiot-proof camera!

Reviews.Title: Love my new camera!
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I originally bought a large Nikon camera and after using it for about 2 weeks I realized I was not happy with the pictures or videos. I loved my old Sony Cybershot so I bought this one because of the large zoom and compact size. It takes amazing pictures and really sharp clear HD videos which is exactly what I was looking for. The things I love about it are the cool picture settings (like having a blurred background or taking a black and white picture only with certain colors showing), the zoom, and the ability to take pictures and videos at the same time! I'm in love with this camera and I'm so happy I chose to buy it and bring the large Nikon back. This camera is a lot smaller and does a better job!

Reviews.Title: Choose the 16.2 Carl Zeiss lens instead
Reviews.Author: epact
Reviews.Content: I tested the 16.2 and the 18 MP cameras. The 16.2 comes with the Carl Zeiss lens. The 18 MP comes with the Sony lens.Nothing can beat the Zeiss lens with only a 2MP difference.And you'll also save yourself some dough.Also, the 16.2 films in true HD, unlike the 18MP.Those who buy the 18MP version because it's not 16.2MP are losing a huge amount of performance.

Reviews.Title: Overall good, but has some issues
Reviews.Author: PhotoJenn
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product from Focus Camera (great seller, by the way), which was fulfilled by Amazon.  I love all the features this camera has, and did experiment with them when the camera first arrived.  I have a Canon T2i as my primary camera, but as a mom on-the-go, I wanted a small point-and-shoot to carry in my purse at all times to have handy for any and all photo moments.  Overall I really like the camera.  Its size is unbelievably small and compact.  The picture quality is decent for a point-and-shoot.  As I mentioned, has many extra "fru-fru" functions (different camera effects) but very little manual control, which was fine for me for my purposes with this camera, but if you're looking for a camera that you can change up ISO, f-stop, shutter speed, etc., this is not the camera.  My two major complaints are:1.  The battery/memory card slot door is VERY flimsy.  For as much as I open and close that thing, I'm not sure how it will hold up over time.  Additionally, the door does not close tightly.  I don't know if that's an issue with just mine, or if that's across the board on this camera.  I feel like I should loop a rubber band around the camera a few times so it's securely closed.2.  At least 50% of the time when I turn the camera on, it tells me that there's no memory card in the camera when there is.  Also, I will sometimes have to press the power button several times in order to get it to turn on or off.As I said, overall it's a good camera.  Not sure if the issues I'm having are exclusive to mine alone or if other owners of the camera have similar issues.

Reviews.Title: Hit and Miss, Mostly Miss! Get the successor out in 2013!
Reviews.Author: E. Tucker
Reviews.Content: Bought the WX150 camera as an upgrade to a few year old Panasonic point and shoot of similar size. I went with the Sony because of it's supposed speed and better low light abilities and 1080 video.The low light photos are better, but with way too much noise reduction. They look like paintings in many shots. The video is much better. The 10X zoom is convenient. But the camera is not all that fast. There's no sport scene option. The super intelligent auto mode takes forever to process every photo taken. The P mode suffers from poor and inconsistent exposures. The AF tracking has a mind of its own. It rarely hits and tracks what you want it to unless you're zoomed in or really close so nothing else is in the frame. It needs to start in the middle of the frame to make it easier to track what you want. Continuous shooting is limited to 10 frames. Processing is slow.The zoom control scales WAY too fast. Nearly impossible to get the zoom you want, plus it flies through to the "intelligent" zoom way to easy. The OIS is not that effective especially in video.The screen I would rate as below average. Very difficult to see in the day and not very sharp for 460K. It also smudges something awful and is difficult to clean. The build is really lightweight flimsy feeling plastic. Which is good and bad. Good that it's really light, bad in that it doesn't feel like it will last long. My Panasonic is mostly metal and not that much heavier. I've run out of room but the list goes on....**** UPDATE 3/2013 ****Please note that the WX150 has stock that is being depleted at many other online retailers.  At this point i would wait until the WX300 is available as it is the successor to this one with very similar features and twice the battery life.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00BEHQKPW/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&camp;=1789&creative;=390957&creativeASIN;=B00BEHQKPW&linkCode;=as2&tag;=stupisms-20Or just go all in and get the RX1... if I only had the cash...http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0097CXFCC/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&camp;=1789&creative;=390957&creativeASIN;=B0097CXFCC&linkCode;=as2&tag;=stupisms-20

Reviews.Title: Small, fast, good photos. All I need.
Reviews.Author: A. Shepard "Rural Art Mom"
Reviews.Content: I really wish this could have been an Amazon purchase, but after watching the prices for 2 months, and realizing I would still be buying from a third party that may or may not be a Sony authorized dealer, I just went ahead and chose an authorized dealer listed on the Sony site that also had great Google reviews.  Saved me 30-50 dollars that way.  If you're spending more than $139 total, you may consider this route too (sadly).  I chose this camera after extensive research on reviews, both professional and by users, and tried the cameras out in stores first.Anyway.. on to the camera.  I just got it in the mail today and have been playing with it on and off. I have an 8gb, class 10 card in it. While it's not the most amazing camera ever made, I get a number of great usable shots, even with a wiggly child, just using the intelligent photo mode. I don't have to try and get her to hold still for 3-5 seconds anymore, and got many photos while I had her moving around, just to see what would happen. It's no 100%, but it's pretty blasted good, and for the size and price point? Incredibly good. My Kodak ran around $200-250 when I bought it, and even on sports mode, doesn't do as well as this Sony in this respect.  The march of technology I guess. So, I guess while not being  the most incredible camera ever, it's one of the most incredible I've actually had in my hands and knew how to use, regardless of price point.The color grabber mode (where everything is black and white, except the color you choose - red, blue, green, yellow) is fun and seems quite accurate :).  This camera is sometimes scary smart, and it's neat to see what mode it sets itself to as you're moving around in different environments. It feels like it's lightyears ahead of my kodak in this respect.  Like the difference between cell phones and smart phones.  And fast?  Omg.. it's MAYBE a full second after turning on that I can take a photo.  No lie.  And I can take back to back photos quickly!  The only mode that seems to take forever is the high iso (to be expected, high isos are usually painfully slow) and the intelligent+.  I was NOT impressed by the intelligent+, as it seemed to add skin softening effects to the photos I took.  And it takes longer to process, so you're down to 2-5 seconds between shots. Macro mode, letting the camera select it while in Intelligent auto, was pretty impressive for a little camera. Things like pen caps, the small text at the bottom of a bottle of crafting stuff... clear as day and big on screen.  I can't wait to try taking photos of flowers with this :)Video so far has been very impressive too.  I took a test video in dim indoor lighting, and it came our great.  Not grainy, the sound was awesome.  Very cool.  And this was on the mp4 setting (which is more universal for websites and programs). The photo-from-video I took was just like a screen shot from the movie.  Same colors, lighting, clarity.Now, the bad.  I, too, found the door to the battery/card compartment to be seriously weak.  C'mon, Sony! When closed, it still leaves a hair of a gap (just enough to gather dirt). The internal latch that actually keeps the door closed is so incredibly tiny.  Out of everything to go wrong on this camera, I'd say it would be that before anything else.  It does come with a 1 year manufacturer warranty, so let's see how far I get with it.  If nothing else, it looks like you could secure it with tape if you had to, and it wouldn't interfere with anything else.Oh, and don't pull on the wrist strap.  Due to the incredibly tiny size of this camera, it seems the plastic on this is a bit on the lighter side, too.  But, you really shouldn't be tugging hard on it anyway, so I don't see this as a serious flaw.  Just be aware.  This camera is tiny and built for small size and small weight. Why wouldn't you consider something like that as anything but delicate?  It's smaller and lighter than my droid phone by a good measure.  Crazy. I have small hands and a great sense of feel, so this camera is incredibly easy for me to use.  I have no problem getting the zoom to work perfect, the selection wheel to go where I want it to (it doesn't look like it from the photos, but aside from it being a 4 way directional button, there really is a wheel there too!)  Contrary to some reviews I have read, it does have a "half-press" shutter action, as in, pressing it halfway down gets your focus, and all the way down takes your picture.  It's just incredibly sensitive, and takes a very light touch. I actually love this, but I could see a lot of people having issues without knowing ahead of time.  The menu takes just a little while to figure out.  For me, going from a kodak to a sony, it was still a breeze to figure it all out.  I had a minor hick up in getting it to recognize the card I formatted for the Sony, though. I had to go into the settings for the photo files, and it figured it out from there.Overall, I would say this is an awesome camera for what I was looking for:  something very very fast, something small, and something that takes good photos with little effort.  This totally fit the bill. I have a feeling I may be using this much more than the more expensive Kodak I bought just a year or two ago.  It's just so much easier to carry, and is so much faster, which is what I need with a small child! The Kodak can do some really neat things, but like another reviewer says, you miss every shot you don't take, and when your camera is 1 lb+ and big, you don't take as many as you could.If the plastic was a little thicker maybe, or at very least, the battery door latched better, I would consider giving this 5 stars.  It really is a smart, fast, fun little camera.  I hope to continue updating this post as time goes on, as I do most of my reviews on electronics and household items.  I also hope to add a video to this review of things I have mentioned here, as well as uploading photos.Update March 12, 2013:  I haven't gotten a ton of playtime with it yet.  But I have yet to recharge the battery.  I expected it to dissipate quickly in the camera due to some other reviews, but it's still showing a totally full charge. Very cool :)  Pet mode doesn't seem to have a flash, so becareful using it in low light areas.  It takes good photos, but my dog highly distrusts it, flash or no, and wont hold still.  Ah well.  So far, still perfect for my needs: fast, good pics, and few errors. I should get more use by Easter, and hopefully get that video up soon!Update March 20, 2013:  I went to finish this review up with some video of the door issue, but it seems a bit of a moot point now.  The manufacturer (sony) has discontinued this camera, so getting a hold of a new one for a reasonable price looks to be almost impossible right now.  It looks like the successor of this camera comes in the form of the WX80 and the more expensive WX300, both of which have wifi and very similar features to this one (even the same buttons and case and look of this model).  I only hope they fixed the battery door issue, because that was the only real complaint I had on this model.  So far, I am still in love with this camera, and I am STILL on the same original charge on the battery. I can't wait to get more usage out of it, and if it gives me a good run, I will definitely consider the WX300 or whatever else they come up with in the future.

Reviews.Title: A good upgrade
Reviews.Author: Nancy Rector
Reviews.Content: I dropped and broke the predecessor to this camera, a Sony DSC-W530. I wanted an upgrade but did not want or need a whole lot of bells and whistles. After reading reviews of the DSC-WX150 and several other brands recommended by my cousin, a professional photographer I picked this camera. I photograph dogs in my grooming salon with some additional pictures of cats and a rabbit at home, which I post on Facebook and my website. Not only are the pictures clear but there is almost no lag time when I click, which was the case with the W530. This baby also takes great shots in low-light circumstances. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: T. Black
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera after having my former Sony Cybershot for many years and it had become bulky and too slow when using a flash (the camera was over 10 years old).  I loved the picture quality of my previous Cybershot so I ordered the Sony Cybershot DSC-WX150.  It is as described...it is compact, takes excellent pictures, has easy to use panoramic and video recording features, and plenty of zoom capabilities.  I would highly recommend this camera!  Love it!

Reviews.Title: So far so good......
Reviews.Author: JohnnyMac
Reviews.Content: This camera replaces an ancient Kodak point and shoot that is not very high end (I think Fred Flinstone used one), so probably many cameras would be considered a huge improvement.  That being said, this is definitely one of them.  I haven't used it much, but so far the biggest improvement for me is speed.  I can crank out multiple pictures in the time it takes to shoot one with the old Kodak.  It also only takes a second or so from pulling it out of my pocket until it's ready to shoot.  Virtually zero boot up time.  18.2 megapixels is freakishly clear/high resolution and 10x zoom is about as far as my shaky hands can hold still.  I did a lot of research and this camera seems to meet all my requirements.  I don't want a touch screen because I'm in Alaska and we wear gloves when it's cold, if it had a manual mode I'd probably screw up the picture and wifi is not anything I care about.  I like to point and shoot then pop out the memory card and put it in my laptop to manipulate the pics.  I prefer a rechargeable battery to AA's.  I'm not disappointed.  You won't be either.  Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: LLC
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift.  I am by no means a photographer, but it is easy to use and I just can't take a bad picture with it, and that is unusual for me!  My son in law is a photographer and loved it so much that he wants one too!  It also takes beautiful beautiful video!  You can't go wrong with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Finally! A Camera That Takes Awesome Pictures!
Reviews.Author: M.L.
Reviews.Content: I've had the worst luck with cameras:  none of the several cameras I've had has ever taken good pictures. I can't explain my bad luck. I research, I study, I test, and yet . . . awful photos.  Finally, a camera that takes great photos!Here's how I see myself: catlike movements silently across the gym floor as I shoot with precise timing to grab that "Awwwww" shot for my sons in the school play or effortlessly shooting the action on the little league field and even the soft focused family shot where everyone looks happy, serene and surrounded by love (and we're all gorgeous, of course).Here's how it really is: bump the lady next to me, accidentally photo bomb the guy behind me and after 100s of shots in just a few minutes, I end up with heads: the guy's head in front of me and the backs of the heads of nearly every first grader on stage. Or the family photo is everyone gathering or separating, or auntie is fuzzy,  the toddlers kinda blend together and there must be an unearthly visitor cuz the upper left corner has a glaring sun spot.This camera can't solve my composition problems, by it's gone a loooooong way toward compensating for every other one of my photographic deficiencies. My photos actually LOOK GOOD.  Better than good. Especially important is that there isn't any lag between shots (or at least I don't notice). I've been frustrated in the past that I have to wait a few seconds before the camera or flash is ready to take another shot. (My family isn't even that patient.)  I didn't know to consider that feature until I suffered repeatedly because of the delay. This little camera is fabulous. The only negative is that it really is diminutive. I have to concentrate on keeping track of it.  If Sony could add a "find my camera" feature, I'd pay a premium.With this purchase, I gave up my grandiose plans of photography excellence, and accepted that I just will not use all the advanced features and adjustments of other cameras. It's too cumbersome and I end up avoiding using a  camera at all. And turns out I don't have to because this little baby takes care of those details so I can focus on the bigger picture. I'm confident that next year the second graders' heads are going to crisp, defined and beautifully colored.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't get much better!
Reviews.Author: CRDnSLC
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Sony WX150 to replace an old Canon which had limited zoom and never really took great pictures, especially in low light. I narrowed my options to this camera and the WX50, which is very similar but has a Carl Zeiss lens, smaller LCD screen, less zoom (5x) and less megapixels. I ended up choosing the WX150 primarily because of the 10x zoom and the larger LCD screen; these features fit my needs better and the special pricing was just right too!Even though I've only had the camera for a short period, about 3 weeks, I've used it quite a bit and am very happy with my decision. Over Thanksgiving weekend I took several hundred pictures and about a dozen videos, 98% of the pictures and all of the videos were perfect. I kept the camera in Intelligent mode for the pictures and it performed exceptionally well through the entire weekend from mornings through night. Low light scenes came out amazing as did varied light scenes at the bowling alley, which are challenging for all compact cameras. I strongly believe this camera will meet the needs for the majority of consumers looking for a sub $200 compact camera. Given the price, features and performance this camera is a keeper!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: I own a Nikon D3100, but found it to be too cumbersome to take along to situations where I needed a smaller camera.  After much research, I came across this camera.  It had good reviews and all the features I was looking for.  I still wanted a high quality picture, but with a longer zoom than the average smaller cameras.  It is perfect!  In fact, I love that you can change your settings so fast and easily to suit your needs.  I did not have to study a manual to learn how to use this camera, which is a good thing.  Some of the cameras that I have owned prior to this one, were not as user friendly.  While, this one still doesn't measure up to an DSLR, you are getting a fine camera for the price. I have not tried the video feature, but it is supposed to be high quality and I have no doubt that it is.  Be sure and purchase a good quality memory card for the camera, as it can make a difference in the quality of your pictures.I would highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Features For A Decent Price
Reviews.Author: Charlie T.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for an upgrade to my Sony Cyber-shot DSC-W350 camera (THE flagship consumer point-and-shoot a few years back).  This camera is the new flagship for Sony's lineup of lower end Point-and-Shoot line, and is an awesome upgrade.  The zoom is amazing, the picture quality is good and always focused, but mainly the video quality and options are great, all of which is why I upgraded this camera.  I will admit the colors have a bit more 'POP' or vividness, but in a good way.  This camera records video up to 1920x1080 60i at 30 frames a second in AVCHD.I highly recommend using the middle quality 1280x720 MP4 option just because of its ease to edit on a PC and WAY lower file size than AVCHD.  I tested video after video between 1920x1080 AVCHD (24Mbps), 1440x1080 MP4 (12 Mbps), 1280X720 MP4 (6Mbps) on a HD computer monitor and 1080 HDTV, and could not tell the difference in color or quality.  The video is clear in low light with little noise and the same with pictures.  The battery life is decent for a point-and-shoot.  The audio quality is very good. It picks up noise at all volumes from whispers to booms and bangs just like the Flip Ultra HD II and Logitech C910, but this camera picks up the booms and bangs WITHOUT distortion (Picks up bass very well unlike the two listed above).Once, I shot a video for YouTube outside in the sun, using a tripod, and the camera, after about 20 minutes, stopped recording and turned off by itself about a minute after I noticed a high temp icon started flashing on the screen.  This is a downside if you are looking to do continuous recording in hot weather as it shuts itself off.  Needless to say, this might affect video recording if you leave this camera in a hot place like a car.  I paid a little over $220 for this camera, and it is a lot better (in just about every way) than my overpriced Flip Ultra HD II.  Although the WX150's (China) build quality isn't as good as my W350 (Japan), it seems like it is better than my W350 in every way.  Panoramic shots are still kinda disappointing on this camera (as with all Sony's), very grainy and low quality.  If you have time to play with this camera, it does come with all kinds of cool, but some useless, effects that you can change in pictures and some carry over to videos like partial color.  You can also take some cool photos in the panoramic mode, such as 3D panoramic photos.  It takes multiple pictures at once synced with the cameras gyroscope, and plays back on the camera as you move the camera.  Neat!This isn't a DSLR or close to it, so don't expect too much manual settings.  Point-and-Shoot.  Overall, if you are looking for a very decent point-and-shoot for very good photos and very nice HD videos for a decent price, this is THE camera to get.Pros:  Great stereo & good 1080i video  Great high-quality photos  10x optical zoom  Fast focusing and minimal shutter lag  3D Panoramic photosCons:  Stops recording in high internal temperatures  Flimsy HDMI cover  Panoramic quality

Reviews.Title: Awesome little camera
Reviews.Author: WLSD22
Reviews.Content: The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX150 18.2 MP is perfect for me. It is small enough to carry in my purse. It is easy to use. I got a red one so I wouldn't lose it! I hope that works. I am not a serious photographer. I take family photos and vacation photos and I am happy when they come out clear. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Point and Shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Autumn
Reviews.Content: I love to have nice pictures but am no expert at taking them and only want to deal with a point and shoot camera. I spent a lot of time reading reviews before I decided to purchase this camera. I am so glad I chose this one. It is almost fool-proof. I got married a few weeks ago and wanted a nice camera to take pictures at our party, wedding, and honeymoon. My friends all took turns using it to take snaphots for me and all said how they loved it. Two of my friends actually purchased the same camera after the wedding. We used it in all conditions: inside and outside, day and night, sunny and cloudy, and while hiking on our honeymoon. We took hundreds of pictures and all turned out great. I could not be happier with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: NJ Shopper
Reviews.Content: The camera works well with still photos and very well with movies.  I am especially happy with the short lag time between pushing the the shutter button and the actual picture taking.  I keep it on the "Easy" setting and I haven't experimented with the advanced options; I did try the panarama setting and was very happy with the results.  I cannot comment on any of the advanced settings but I would definitely recommend this camera for the average family use.  No down side so far.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Pictures
Reviews.Author: bigsnowflakes
Reviews.Content: The pictures I took were top notch and then I lost the camera and got really depressed.  It was such a convenient (small) little camera to grab and go, and a mp upgrade from my Pentax Optio P70 that I loved and also takes great shots.The things I did not like about it were the dials and controls and "hook" closures for the battery and memory card.  It was so fast I almost couldn't stop the Auto Focus at the right spot, but that was good for catching something quickly, altho I missed a lot of shots cuz I wasn't ready and had to find the controls.  The tiny grab dial to zoom in or out was hard to find and I kept hitting something next to or above it, some dial, can't remember now.  I tried to catch an eagle on the Elk Refuge in a tree before he flew away and got a great shot, but it was VERY hard to hold steady when in a hurry and getting the panic button shot where you needed good control over what you were doing to hold/focus/zoom/press without moving so much.  The camera is so fast but my fingers were freezing in this incident and I was on a sleigh with about 15 other people also trying to see the eagle.  I got lucky with my eagle shot.  I blew it up to 13 x 19 I think...big...and it is really nice.  An 8x10 would prob be amazing considering all the panic that went into the shot.I could not get my videos to show up in iphoto as videos.  I had a 10 video card.  I don't know where they are.I was going to buy another one, the silver one is a great deal right now, but researched several other sites and found the Sony Cyber Shot HX10V which design wise is just what I want.  I got it at a great price, for only about $50 more than the blue WX150 ($188) cost me, and so I thought I'd try it. It has a few more choices for being creative.  WX150, I didn't play around with too much cuz auto was so fast and pictures, how could I do better!  I just hadn't gotten to that part of experimentation with it yet.  Rates on the HX10V on Sony.com site are great.  I am only hoping that the pictures will be as good or better.This little Blue Sony WX150 is wonderful but clumsy controls are small.  The on/off button is flush with the top and very small making it hard to find/turn on quickly, but it turns on fast once you find the button.  The battery/card open/close door is crummy.  You have to use your finger nail on a very tiny door, also flush with the bottom, instead of the old slide open with your thumb method which I like/love.I was trying to catch something (a rapidly dying sunset shot) while driving slowly down a road one evening and I dropped the camera from my almost rolled down window and I watched it fall about 10-15 feet from the car door on the hard icey road.  The battery fell out and the door was open.  I got out of the car depressed at what I had done, picked it up almost crying, but the camera suffered nothing at all.  (yea, thank you God)I was impressed with this, but I'd check out the HX10V.  It's really worth paying up to get rid of small aggravating details.  same 18 mp and more optical zoom, but you never know.  Staying hopeful.

Reviews.Title: blurry indoors and in low light, great in outdoor sunny conditions
Reviews.Author: ls
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for outdoor sunny pictures, however the main reason I purchased this camera was because of the great professional reviews on no blurriness in low light. Extremely disappointed. 75% of images taken indoors with great light and no flash are blurry.  If you use some of the blur reducing or "better"settings it takes about 5 seconds to process after you take the picture and with most things you miss parts of the action!  Had a Canon previously and did not have this issue, should have stuck with what I know I liked.

Reviews.Title: powerful, versatile camera  (and a comparison with Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX66)
Reviews.Author: Sreeram Ramakrishnan
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice for a camera in this category providing a 10X optical zoom and a variety of useful shooting modes (low light performance is very impressive, so are the panorma sweep, soft skin and background de-focus).  It touts the ability to take 3D pictures and underwater capabilities (though I've not tested either). Compared to the pricier Sony Cyber-shot DSC-TX66 18.2 MP Exmor R CMOS Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 3.3-inch OLED (White) (2012 Model), this one provides more zoom; however the pricier DSC-TX66 provides a touch-screen control (OLED display) and is much thinner and lighter.  The picture and video settings are almost identical for both cameras.  Just like other cameras in this family, the battery compartment doesn't inspire much confidence with its flimsy looks.Having used to the touch-screen controls of TX66, the scroll-based menu in the WX150 seems less impressive - however, the controls on both are very intuitive - given the wide range of options, it will take some time to get used to all the command settings.  The video quality of both cameras are exceptional - and either will replace a handycam easily.  If you are more interested in a lighter camera with a touch screen and willing to compromise on the zoom (5X opposed to 10X in the WX150) and pay up for it (about 100$ more), DSC-TX66 may be a better choice. But if the touchscreen is not a critical requirement for you and zoom is of more importance, WX150 is a very compelling choice at this price-point. The DSLR-like quality with a very respectable zoom, plethora of picture settings options, and fairly intuitive scroll-based menus makes this a good value.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Behnken207
Reviews.Content: Sony Cybershot wx150 18.2mp. Got this camera yesterday and had a fun test session with my Grand daughter and dog. It was really easy to figure out w/o reading the instructions. Accessing the menus and settings was simple and easy to understand. The software is in the camera already so you hook it to your PC with the cable provided and it uploads what you need to  edit, crop etc. That was easy as well. I LOVE the photo quality, very crisp and the ZOOM is FABULOUS and clear !. I will use this camera a lot as my DSLR is rather large to keep in my purse. I dont get into technical details because I have NO idea what I am talking about !! :) Its just a great and easy camera to use with great results.

Reviews.Title: Complete disappointment
Reviews.Author: J. Mahoney "Mahojo"
Reviews.Content: Frustrating.1. don't count on using the background defocus. It's fickle. It worked maybe 5% of the time and even then, it focused on the wrong image.2. If you have a Mac, have fun. You can't upload videos to iPhoto. You have to use iMovie or upload to your computer, purchase special software from Apple's site to convert files to view them in Quicktime.3. The battery drains so fast. It's astonishing.4. The battery takes FOR...EVER... to charge.5. Do you like auto focus when you take video and want to zoom in? Well it doesn't do that well either. Once you zoom in so far, it stops focusing and everything is blurry.6. The icing?  The manual OR should I say "manual" it comes with is not a manual. If you call customer support (which you probably will, it's 800-222-7669) they will offer to email you the FULL manual. Really??? Why wouldn't I want the full manual from the start?I've owned Lumix, Cannon, Panasonic and other Sony digital cameras. I've never had so many problems with one camera before. This one's going back.OCT. 1st. 2012 UPDATE!  I just bought the Panasonic DMC-ZS19. I've been playing with it all day. NO problems. I love it. LOVE IT! The zoom with auto focus is amazing compared to the Sony. It has all the great features & bells & whistles as the SOny minus the background defocus, but I was told by a sales associate that it was just a Sony gimmick anyway. It wasn't intended to work well and it is the only point & shoot with the feature but in the future there will be more and they will work better. LOVE my Lumix!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: BookIT
Reviews.Content: i bought this for my wife about a year ago. It has been great. It does drain the battery fairly quickly so I bought an extra batt. This take great pictures. We took it to Yellowstone and was amazed when we got back at how well it did. We have some fantastic shots of all sorts of animals and landscapes.

Reviews.Title: Great features but stopped working
Reviews.Author: LR Evans
Reviews.Content: The USB port stopped charging the battery after only a week.  I don't use the USB but have an AC charger with spare batteries so no big deal but be warned.UPDATE 6-18-2013:  The camera now won't turn on and appears to have a problem with the lens motor failing with error flashing C32:60 and turns off by itself.  Only lasted 1 month.

Reviews.Title: Cheap camera that does not work well
Reviews.Author: Catherine
Reviews.Content: I should have returned this camera as soon as I got it.  I have not had too much chance to dislike it since after less than 3 months it has stopped working entirely and I have to pay to ship it to Sony.  Amazon would not give me a merchandise credit for another model as I requested.  This camera takes forever between shots,and has a slow shutter speed, so is useless to capture my kids during their sports events.  It refuses to focus on what is in the small focus box, focusing instead on something irrelevant in the picture.  The menu is extremely hard to navigate, and has no typical automatic presets like "sports mode'.Overall, I hate this camera and am angry that I have to return it for repairs rather than getting a merchandise credit to replace it with a different model.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Catherine. Heathcliff "Cathy"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. It is light weight and easy to use.  The pictures are great - good quality.  I researched many models and brands, and this one got the best reviews.  My only objection is the noise.  I can't figure out how to make it silent.  I have turned the noise volume down as far as it goes, but it still makes noise when I turn the camera on. This is a problem if I am in a place where I want quiet - like a wedding, a lecture or a group when a guide is talking.  Other than that, I have nothing bad to say about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful little camera!
Reviews.Author: J Solko
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. Emphasis on little. At first I was put off on how small it was. I have a very nice canon dslr and am used to a heavy camera so I initially dismissed it, thinking that there is no way it can take good pictures when it is this small. I have no complaints about their tire quality. It has impressed me with its picture quality in daylight, cloudy pictures and at night with the lamps on. The pictures look natural and crisp. My complaints are mostly related to its buttons. Being so small they didn't have a lot of room to space the buttons out properly. I feel like I am always going to hit a button I don't mean to because they are all so close together. I am a man and have normal/large size hands. My wife also has larger hands but has no complaints about this, I suppose because she can use her fingernail. The build quality does feel a little plasticky(I think I am making that word up!) but overall I am so please with the pictures it takes I don't mind that. We purchased another more expensive, supposedly much better quality point and shoot compact camera by panasonic and we returned it after comparing it with this. My advice, save some money and buy this great little camera, it won't disappoint!

Reviews.Title: satisfied
Reviews.Author: Lovin Christ "Smitty"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to have a handy point-n-shoot while on vacation in Grand Cayman and Jamacia instead of carrying around my Canon EOS and running the risk of damaging it. With that said, I found the sony relatively easy to use (not totally intuitive) but out of the box I could move around settings a take some interesting shots.  I like the size and wrist strap, made it easy to grab and take a quick shot. Picture quality is nice, just viewing on my pc, I have not printed any pics yet.  I read many of the reviews (and some quite helpful) and agree that many of the features or "bell-n-whistles" are good selling points,however,  I think they grab attention initally and the need for simplicity takes over and most of us will just revert to capturing memories. I must say, the panoramic sweep was a useful feature and it worked very well for me (some reviewers were not impressed by it).My biggest issues are the battery charging feature and the cost. Charging the battery through the camera, did create an inconvenience.  Overall I like the camera and it works well.

Reviews.Title: Compact and Good Pics
Reviews.Author: J. Dawson
Reviews.Content: This camera is compact and easy to put into a pocket. It's easy to use with a lot of nice features. I use for family and sport photos.

Reviews.Title: Great 2012 Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Broussard
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for the discounted price ($160) as it was last years model but I am not disappointed. The camera works great right out of the box. Takes wonderful pictures with and without flash and especially in low light situations the pics are clear and great. Video quality is good too but sound is low in my opinion. I bought the Polaroid Dive-Rated Waterproof Camera Housing For The Sony Cybershot as well and it works good for water shots! Can't beat the price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera for candid snaps on vacation or on-the-go, too many features, poor user guide
Reviews.Author: W. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I bought this in preparation for a family reunion in Florida. I wanted something small that I could put in a pocket and pull out quickly, and still get good shots. It fit that need perfectly. I bought a Transend class 10 SDXC 64GB card, which will hold something like 10,000 pics at the highest resolution. I also bought 2 extra batteries. the Wasabi battery kit worked great.The feature set might be common on cameras todayPRO:size: it is twice the thickness of my smart phone. It fits in my shirt pocket, one of the small pockets on my cargo shorts, or even the watch pocket of my jeans.zoom: the 10x zoom came out great. It starts fairly wide angle, so I usually zoom in a bit for family shots.smart+: it has a 'leave everything to the camera' setting that worked great for me -- i think it does some post-processing.easy mode: makes the print on the screen bigger!select-a-scene: there are lots of special case situations  you can select: at the beach, sunsets, two anti-shake selections... more than I will probably ever bother to investigate.CON:instructions - It took me two days to figure out how to get the thing not to flash! I was putting my finger over the flash so as not to get reflections back. annoying and not in the meager instructions. This is the only 'basic' function that was not obvious. In retrospect, it should have been obvious, so this is probably not much of a 'con'.movie button - there is a tiny button on the back that is hard to press, but that you have to press to take movies. There is a slider switch that says 'still' or 'movie', which one would think would tell the camera to take stills or movies when you press the regular button on top. But as far as I can tell it does nothing and you have to push the tiny button to start shooting the movies, which meant that all my movies  started and ended with pictures of my shoes, or terrible shake. I think they did this so you could take stills while in the middle of shooting a movie.Just in case someone does not know this, a warning:I have Mac computers, which do not handle the hi-def movies of the Sony cameras -- shame on Apple!If anyone knows any good fix for this, please let me know.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, which was important to me.  Love the special effects it has for photos - for example, black and white except for any RED in the photo.  Also can take very close, very clear photos - which was important to me.

Reviews.Title: Very Good little camera with lots more features than you can use.
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I previously had purchased a Cannon SS100.  Lost the crystal screen after about a year.  This is about the samecamera with a 10 power rather than 5.  More than satisfied.  Would recommend to anyone looking for a compactcamera with good results.

Reviews.Title: Great in low light, astonishingly fast - love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Kathryn DeHaan
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a mother of 2 (soon to be 3) kids and needed something that can take good pictures in low light as well as with a fast auto-focus so I can snap the picture before the kids run out of the frame, and this camera has blown me away on both counts. I have actually been using it mostly with the flash off, even indoors with the blinds closed and feel like I'm using my old SLR camera in terms of how fast the shutter response time is since it is so fast to focus. The zoom is also surprisingly good considering how tiny the camera body is, and I love how I can just carry it in my purse - it's actually smaller than my phone so it's easy to have it with me all the time. I feel a bit silly for how excited I've been about this camera, but it is really thrilling to get such great results for such a reasonable price! I'm also enjoying the "background defocus" setting to get dslr-like portraits.We bought one for my mom for Christmas as well since she seldom wears her glasses and with this camera it won't matter if she can see if things are clear or not b/c the camera does such a great job of getting clear pictures on the automatic settings just by pointing and shooting.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: SurferDude
Reviews.Content: Literally use this camera everyday and love every moment with it. Just recently took it to St. Thomas USVI and the pictures and video came out amazing! It sips battery life like no other. I hardly went through a full battery in the 4 days of constant video and shooting. Just great! I bought a $20 waterproof case for the camera and took it snorkeling. It worked just as good in water as out. Although I wish the case was a bit more clear. All in all I have nothing negative to say. The embedded picture modes such as; pop, illustration, watercolor, and painting are all awesome! I try to keep all my pictures unedited and these modes make life easy creating fancy editing effects without all the hassle.

Reviews.Title: Almost 5 stars!
Reviews.Author: Burns O. Bailey "Bob B."
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace my last Sony Cyber-Shot (I dropped it with the lens out and it bent) I would have given this camera 5+ stars if Sony had addressed the one thing I disliked about my last one. I love these camera's because they fit so well in my front pocket on vacation and other events so I tend to take it more places with me. The problem with the last one (and this one) is as you slide it into and out of your pocket, it will change the settings so I would miss some good shots until I realized the setting was wrong. I thought for sure Sony would have addressed this issue but I was wrong, this camera's setting knob now is even more sensitive that my last one.Having said this, this camera takes amazing pictures and with it in movie mode, it is even more amazing. I would strongly recommend this camera, just take a look at your settings if you carry in your pocket like me.Also, forgot to mention that it does not come with a memory card. This is a bit disappointing as most buyers would like to give it a try as soon as they receive it....... a little cheap on Sony's part.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: mharper
Reviews.Content: It has been a really long time since I have gotten a new camera--10 years, to be exact.  I read a ton of reviews, and PC magazine rates this camera as #2 of their top ten point-n-shoot picks, something I found in several other places.  It does not disappoint.  My next camera, hopefully not in 10 years, is going to be a D-SLR.  But for point and shoot, this is perfect!  Clear pictures!  Even of running children, which is SO important to me.  Great zoom.  Outside pics my favorite, and really good low light pics.  My only issue has been a couple of really white pictures with the flash, but I just play with the lighting a bit and have no problem after that.  Love, love, love this camera!  And I LOVE taking pictures!

Reviews.Title: good compact camera
Reviews.Author: L. H. Szu
Reviews.Content: I would recommand this camera who has young kids and want to capture their cuteness easily. The camera is compact and so you can insert it in the pocket. Also, it has a lot of modes you can set and take really good picture even when the kids are moving or indoors.

Reviews.Title: Do you own a Mac?
Reviews.Author: LP Weinberg
Reviews.Content: If you own a Mac, Sony software will not let you store the highest quality video on iPhoto. As I learned, Sony and Apple have had these compatibility issues before. There is also a prominent sticker on the camera detailing the need to download drivers for Windows as well. I think a camera ought to be ready to go out of the box. Hardware is irrelevant when the software is inadequate.

Reviews.Title: Finally *Big Happy Face* [Initially]
Reviews.Author: Krystal Jag
Reviews.Content: November - 2012**The camera is ONE day old from being opened and used for several test shots; playing around with the settings etc.¤Initial reaction to seeing it :WOW, it's REALLY blue... So pretty... Must find a case to protect it! :D¤Initial opinionS after taking the first few shots:1)FINALLY! FINALLY!!!! I THINK I'M ACTUALLY GOING TO GET WHAT I HAVE BEEN LOOKING FOR! AND I CAN'T BELIEVE I GOT IT FOR THAT PRICE!!!! [I got it for $168]2)CMOS instead of CCD really really the way to go, pictures in the lowish light conditions came out sharp and clear with out flash. [I MUST AND WILL test this further in proper LOW light conditions :)]3)WHAT? WHAT? IT TAKES THE PICTURE ALMOST IMMEDIATELY AS YOU PRESS THE BUTTON???? [I am trying to not get my hopes up... but so far... i really think... *tears of joy in my eyes*.... i really think that there is almost NO shutter delay! *happy squeak**********5 months later********I guess compared to other digital compacts, especially for the price, this camera does in fact top them all right now... Which is a loaded statement so don't take it lightly just because i didn't emphasize with capital letters :D  ... But i think i'm just so demanding that what it would take to make me complaint free is an SLR.I did test in lower light conditions, I was not too thrilled but i think it's because i had unrealistic expectations. This camera by far performed better than my friends' cameras of similar specs but with CCD.I recommend buying an extra battery because once u are using flash, the life span is not long. Still, this camera is pretty awesome for a point and shoot in terms of the zoom, resolution and colours of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Decent, very compact camera with over-aggressive compression
Reviews.Author: TOPJOB7 "topjob7"
Reviews.Content: This is a decent, surprisingly compact camera for all it offers.  One thing that kept me from giving it 5 stars is the over-aggressive compression - zoom in and the compression artifacts really deter from the picture quality.What's the point of 18.2MP if you just waste it?!  The whole point of higher MP is to allow blowing up a picture or part of one.  Might as well be a 6MP camera.That said, this is a very capable little camera for such a small size.Good:Thin and lightning-quickPower-save reduces screen brightness when not in useControls easy to figure outHas a lot of cool featuresWill take multiple pictures and combine the bestAllows simple photography while filmingTakes cool 3D panoramasTakes 3D photosWhen viewing photos, switching from one picture to the next is lightning-fast (can be used to view stop-motion)Cons:Can't adjust picture quality (compression, mostly)Can't adjust exposure timeCan't manually focusPhoto trimming feature is mostly wasted - takes too large stepsWhen trying to zoom in on a photo you already took, it takes 2 seconds to enter zoom mode.Stuff we really liked:"Backlight Correction HDR"; uses multiple photos to reduce under- and over-exposure.Clear Image Zoom (zooms in on portion of CCD chip)Other:Comes with USB>Micro USB cord and adapter for wall outletBattery charges inside cameraCamera has built-in manualComes with a paper booklet that has technical details and some setup info

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with picture quality
Reviews.Author: Theresa
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews, but I must say that I was quite disappointed with this camera. I've had a Kodak for years now and it's only 8 megapixel so I figured it was about time for an upgrade. Well, after much research I decided to try this camera out. I received it today so I tested it out by taking about 20-30 pictures of my baby. I'd say out of those about half of them were blurry and if you zoom in on the ones that weren't blurry they had a sort of oil painting quality about them - it's weird. Anyway, I zoomed in on 1 of these new pictures and compared it side by side with a zoomed in picture from my old Kodak and in my opinion my Kodak picture was better! I showed it to my brother as well (I didn't tell him which picture was from which camera) and he also thought my old picture was better. I'm still giving this camera 3 stars because I can't actually say the pictures were bad, but why would I want to pay so much for a new camera if the quality wasn't any better than my old camera? Needless to say I will be returning this camera :(

Reviews.Title: A Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Konstantin Orlov
Reviews.Content: I bought it today. we took several hundreds of pictures with my wife and a newly born kid... guys, i simply love it! all those havy pro cameras are great, but if you dont have people posing for 24 hours there and you need a FAST and a QUALITY shot - get this camera! you'd love it!in fact, it can take hundreds of pictures in a sequence, i.e. until you let go of the button. :) just like the pro cam does.i'm 100% happy with it and i tell you, i haven't seen anything like it before. something that light, that slim and that high quality!get it, you woun't regret it. i was surprised by it. in a good way :)

Reviews.Title: Great Pics then it went crazy
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I had thr devicr for less than a week..i took a few practice shots with it and then went on vacation. One day into my trip the camera started to power on by itself. It enters playback mode and sometimes the lens shoots out. It does this in my pocket and even when sitting on the table hours after my last use.  I contacted Sony and they had me reset it but the issue continued..they then said it needed to be serviced.. The camera is less than a week old so I'm sending it back for a return. It did take nice pics though.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Alvaro Sierra
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a good compact camera. I like the options it has like the burst shooting mode. The only thing it lacked was wifi but I am content with what I got

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Sean Dinneen
Reviews.Content: Great camera! It takes very clear pictures and is easy to use.  Decent battery life and all around great buy! Cannot go wrong for $140 18 MP camera.

Reviews.Title: A very expensive disposable camera
Reviews.Author: ne_pats_fan_27
Reviews.Content: After just over a year of use, getting error E:62:10, which Sony will only fix if I give them $91.  On top of that, when I take a picture and then immediately look at it, it is rotated 90 degrees.  I've Initialized the camera, formatted the memory card, tried tapping the battery side, and every other solution I can find online and nothing works.  This camera has been a huge disappointment.  Do not buy.

Reviews.Title: Very clear picture
Reviews.Author: Zula
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take higher quality video than my last camera was able to produce.  I have been very pleased with all aspects of the camera.  It is small, light, and takes great shots.

Reviews.Title: Sony Camera
Reviews.Author: Marianne Lewis
Reviews.Content: I have researched digital cameras for years before I found this one.  It is terrific - especially the clarity of my zoomed pictures.  I am extremely satisfied with this purchase.  I'm sure I could do much more with this camera but do not know how so I just use the Easy automatic feature.

Reviews.Title: WX-150 User Friendly-Great Photos
Reviews.Author: JoLM
Reviews.Content: An amazing little camera.  18 mp and the zoom works well keeping the picture clean and clear.  The controls are so easy to learn and use.  I have seen a lot of camera's over the years...and this is a keeper. The editing tools are fantastic and fun and produce some unique and beautiful photos at any size.  It is great to carry around which is why I bought it in the first place.  I was tired of toting around my bulky cameras and gear.  I have two nice DSL's (Nikon D40 and 5000) and I use this camera more LoL really!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Carmera
Reviews.Author: Pworld
Reviews.Content: This camera is outstanding for the price. The pictures look amazing and the video you can record with in 1080p looks fantastic. 18 megapixels, you can't beat that. I love it!

Reviews.Title: A Decent Compromise
Reviews.Author: Rick Bennette "Rick Bennette"
Reviews.Content: This camera produces better images and videos than an iPhone, and has a full flash. The lens provides sharp imaging corner to corner with virtually no chromatic aberration. It isn't a fat lens, but it's very sharp. It is significantly better than the lenses on comparably priced Nikon and Canon point-and-shoots. Those tend to produce chromatic aberration in the corners of the image.There are over a dozen pre-programmed exposure modes to select. Some parameters like white balance, flash and ISO can be selected manually, while others like iris and shutter can not. Manual exposure control is limited to plus or minus two F-stops from the automatic exposure, which is better than no control at all.With the right conditions and reasonable user experience, some stellar photos including close ups can be made with this camera because of its excellent lens characteristics. It is small enough to carry around in a pants pocket, making it more likely to be present on your person than a bigger camera.

Reviews.Title: Great photos every time. I am addicted to the panoramic mode.
Reviews.Author: Dr. Z "d0ktaz"
Reviews.Content: With more features than a non-pro would ever need to use, this Sony camera is perfect for capturing the big moments in your life. I purchased this specifically to record my climb of Kilimanjaro this summer. It did not disappoint. I captured beautiful vistas above the clouds while also getting some great portraits and landscapes. Also great for the beach and the city. Although you have to be careful with lighting on cloudy days. There is some post processing work that can be done to make up for that, although you may be able to find a setting on the camera to optimize the captured image.When doing my camera research, I found that this camera was the next best thing to investing a lot of money on a DSLR. While I do think that DSLRs are great, I didn't want to risk breaking one or bother with carrying one. This camera turned out to be the best near-DSLR quality point-and-shoot on the market.Would recommend this to anyone who wants to upgrade from a normal digital camera but doesn't want the worry of a very expensive camera or having to spend too much time on learning how to use it. If you are on a budget but want high-quality photos, this one is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Sony WX-150
Reviews.Author: Terry R. Hall "pterosonus"
Reviews.Content: Very nice truly pocketable digicam. Very, very fast on focusing, shutter lag, between shot time and writing to memory card. Image quality is very good for a 1/2.33 sensor. Very little noise in good light and nice punchy colors. Lots of filters, effects and post-picture processing. Major drawback is maximum aperture of only 3.3, but for its size factor (tiny!) and having a ten X zoom, that's to be expected. Lens is top of the line Sony G and extremely sharp. This was the king of the hill until the Sony RX100 came out with its 1" sensor, but it's twice the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures. It also has a lot of fun features to play with. Came in handy for my European vacation, and now I take it everywhere with me! I'm not camera savvy at all so for me, it's a great and easy 'point and shoot' for everyday use!

Reviews.Title: very good hiking camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Jercich
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an inexpensive point and shoot camera for hiking, this is it!Very good photos with a good lens and simple to use.The only thing I am leery about is durability. With the lens extended if a jolt occurs the camera could be in trouble. The price makes this an easy decision.  My daughter fell in love with it while traveling in Europe. I don't think I am getting it back so I will buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Great Price. Pretty Good at Taking Pictures
Reviews.Author: Jim Niemela
Reviews.Content: For the price that I bought this camera, overall I have been pleased with it. It is a nice point and shoot camera. The battery life is pretty good. As for taking pictures though, I am a little disappointed with a few things. When you take a picture, and look at it on the computer it looks pretty good, but when you start zooming in however, the photo starts to look like its an oil painting or something - it gets kind of blurry. But for the most part, the photos are pretty clear. I haven't had any problems with recording videos though, the quality is really good. Overall, I think for the price and the features this camera comes with, that it is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Great value and awesome product
Reviews.Author: Lexi
Reviews.Content: I chose this product because it seemed to be the cheapest option with the features I wanted. We bought this product the week before our daughter was born.I have loved this camera! I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is a novice to photography. It is easy to use and gives really great pictures without a lot of knowledge about ISO, shutter speed, etc. Also, the "soft skin" feature is AMAZING! It takes away skin blemishes naturally and really just enhances the pictures.The ONLY con I can think of is that on most settings, it takes a few seconds between shots. It has to "process" the image before you can take the next picture and that is usually around 3-6 seconds. Which means, you can miss a shot if you're not ready.

Reviews.Title: Takes beautiful pictures even for the camera challenged person
Reviews.Author: elli
Reviews.Content: Great little pocket (or purse-able) camera.  I'm really lame when it comes to cameras, sigh.  This camera really helps with my camera dyslexia.  I have it set to the "intelligent" setting & the camera does the rest ... somehow the pictures just come out beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect, Almost
Reviews.Author: Johnny B.
Reviews.Content: Pics are great. Quality of the camera is great. Sharing long videos...SUCKS. I used the camera to record about 20 minutes of baseball and the footage is brilliant. I could load it on my computer, take stills from it, time lapse it, etc.However, the Sony software that you have to use to show the video is in a Sony format. So, I could not put it on a disc without convedrting it or forcing a friend download the Sony software. It allows you to load it to YouTube and other services but my YouTube account will only allow me to load about 5 minutes of video.As far as ease of use, image quality, and amenities this was a great buy. Software constraints gave it a 4.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, battery didn't last long
Reviews.Author: Fosalyer
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera in January and the battery died last week. Wouldn't work at all and I was afraid that it was the camera. Took it to Batteries plus and they tested the battery-dead (I had tried charging it on the wall and with the computer with no luck prior to this.) A new battery and we're back in business. I love it, but hope the battery isn't an issue anymore. At least I have a year warrantee on the new battery!Update 10/22/2013 New battery died as well so tried to charge battery with a charging unit. Charging unit says the battery is fully charged. Sounds like a camera issue now. Not very happy.

Reviews.Title: Nice cam But read the cons...
Reviews.Author: Juan Diego Delgado Vargas
Reviews.Content: I bought this cam for a trip to Peru and Machu Picchu.However I can say, that I was expecting a bit more. It might have some problems with black light or shinny backgrounds. I did a Trek which actually goes to some Snow peaks, and I really wanted to take beautiful pictures of them. But as u might now, Snow + Sun, make them really really bright, and the camera just cant handle it correctly in Automatic Pics. I did some manual changes, and tried to get the most of it, but some other cams from my friends took better pics than mine.In the other side, I also went to the Beach, and the pictures where just AWESOME. The quality was really really nice, and the Full HD videos where also great. I know this is not professional camera, so I think it takes really good pictures for its price.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Mom2MandN
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures! Im just a mom taking picture of my kids so it works great for what I need it for. The pictures are crisp and sharp, the hd video recording is awesome and its so convenient to have it right in the camera. It has a lot of shooting options and I have yet to use a lot of them. I have taken some scenery pictures and theyve all been gorgeous as well. Im very happy with this camera. Its powerful and small, exactly what I needed to snap pictures of my kids.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: boynoyce
Reviews.Content: this camera was easy to use out of the box- takes good pictures and I like the panorama feature and use it often.
