The video camera button takes a little getting used to but the videos are also good quality. The lock on the door to access the battery and memory chip is counter intuitive but works well. We are happy with this purchase and I would recommend purchasing extra batteries and a charger.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!!
Reviews.Author: Li Yan Zhu
Reviews.Content: I got what I was looking for. You described it perfectly. I loved it!! Love the how the pictures come out.

Reviews.Title: Finally!!!!
Reviews.Author: Donna T. Johns
Reviews.Content: I waited over a year before ordering this camera. I looked at others, compared, read reviews, thought about it....I'm really glad I finally got it.  I'm still learning about it, but so far I love it.

Reviews.Title: Nice quality, good pictures
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Wilhelmsson
Reviews.Content: Have only had the camera for a few days, but feel like I am already sold on it.Love the rapid shots, which can be viewed in stopmotion by tilting the camera when reviewing them, love the pop color, the simultaneous camera and video ability, the fast speed, the easy to understand menus, the look, the size and the panorama shots. It's all good. ^^As far as memorycard speeds go, the camera itself is rated as a class 4 device. I got a 45MB/sec Sandisk Extreme card. I clocked the writing speed of 10 rapid shots at 6.5 seconds. When I compared it with a Class 6 Sandisk card, there was no difference in speed. At all. Just FYI everyone. Still, writing 10x 5.5MB pictures in 6.5 seconds averages to about 8.5MB/sec meaning the Class 6 card (also Sandisk) was "overperforming". A Class 10 card is probably good to get just to be sure you reach that speed with other brands. On the other hand, no gain can be had by getting a UHS card. At least with this (and most other) cameras.

Reviews.Title: A great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Beka Butler
Reviews.Content: I have been a photographer for 10+ years. Having 2 toddlers and now another child on the way, i felt it was time to get out of the business and be a stay at home mom! So i sold all my equipment and was looking for something at almost the same quality but very compact that i could whip out fast and would be great for kids on the run! WELL after weeks of searching i found this and let me tell you the picture quality is AMAZING! I LOVE the fact that it has a "kid on the go" mode for those little ones that dont sit still much like my children! I would HIGHLY recommend this camera to anyone. The only complaint i have is it DOES look cheap and feels light so it feels cheap. But its DEF not! I think im just so use to my 15lb DSLR cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good and the mediocre
Reviews.Author: RocketMan
Reviews.Content: I use it to take lots of photos for work.  I need easy operation and reasonable quality. This is a good steady camera for photos and movies, competent like it should be. Nice features.  No complaints with build quality. It is worth a good sale price, but I would choose another camera if the price is not a deal.  It's faster reloading for shots than my old camera, but if speed is your thing this one seems average only.Cons:Power button is clumsy to manipulateProgram selector wheel easily jostles out of position.  If you mostly use the same auto setting, must check it whenever taken out of a pocket, etcCan't figure out how to delete photos from the computer.  After I transfer photos to computer, must go back to camera and delete from there

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Conrad Borba
Reviews.Content: Thin and light with a nice big screen (I do recommend a screen protector). Tons of options and pretty easy to use. The user interface is pretty slick. It is amazingly fast to turn on and start shooting. The stats speak for them self.You can't go wrong with this camera. All you have to decide is what color you want.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: Jose Raya
Reviews.Content: This camera takes amazing pictures, even at low light without having to use the flash. The panoramic feature is great, and the quality of the pics is amazing. If you're looking for a simple point and shoot camera that will take great pictures, this is it! Best point and shoot camera I've ever had by far. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Super light
Reviews.Author: Cookie Gerhart
Reviews.Content: Great purchase. Takes awesome pics. Haven't used all its functions but carry with me all the time. Battery life lasts long.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy So Far
Reviews.Author: Karen Hart
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for it's small size.  It will be easy to tuck into my purse or back pack.  I've been practicing with the settings, and am very happy with the pictures I've taken so far. We'll be taking a cruise to Alaska this summer, and I wanted a small camera to take along.  This camera seems perfect for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for everyday type of use
Reviews.Author: JCTama "Tama"
Reviews.Content: I am not much of a photographer, but I like taking nice pictures. And this camera sure helps me to do that. I am enjoying the quality of the camera and the way that it takes pictures at night time. It's great! Maybe my old camera was an antique compared to some of the ones available today, but I'm really liking this one. It was not expensive and it's a great quality. I love SONY.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.
Reviews.Author: partyparty
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife, as a gift and did a lot of research. Seems the best out there for value and performance. Picture quality is superb and has lot of features, but easy to understand, which is important. This replaced 2 previous Kodak digital cameras, which were both really a waste of money and time.

Reviews.Title: best compact point to shoot camera
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: took this camera on a trip to Germany and totally Loved the compact size of the camera and the beautiful clear pictures it takes.Super easy to use and would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Steady shot is just what I need while taking photos from motorcycle
Reviews.Author: Julie C. Stickler
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!  Photos are awesome.  Especially impressed with the steady shot feature, as most of our photos are taken from the back of our motorcycle while riding down the road.  Incredible all the way around!

Reviews.Title: Cool camera but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Tracy Cann
Reviews.Content: Biggest drawback is the little door where the battery goes doesn't close all that great and can open easily.  Can't see how that could be good for the camera long term but so far it works fine.  Still figuring out all the options but like it overall.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: skirgrl
Reviews.Content: I am no photographer, but I am very active and like to carry my camera when skiing, traveling, hiking, etc and I want a camera with litlle size and weight that takes great pictures.  This is it.  Added bonus are the fun settings for watercolor, illustration, etc.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful video... pics look great too
Reviews.Author: Popeboy
Reviews.Content: Videos and Pictures look really good. If you are not looking for a camera with RAW capabilities this little one is great. Pictures are in jpg format, which if you don't know what I am talking about THIS camera IS for you. Video is in AVCHD. Win 7 handles it perfectly. Win XP you will need to download a codex, just search for it. This camera was for my wife who always complained that my pictures are in RAW format.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Sylvester Tan
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera from Sony, as stated in the description it is very fast to take pictures. For such a small camera is packs a punch with 10x optical zoom and 18 MP. Battery life seems to hold well too.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera but wait for it to go on sale
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: If you're paying the full price tag for this camera then you're not getting a good deal.  Let's just put it that way.  Wait for it to go on sale since it should drop at least a hundred bucks below the MSRP.  With that out of the way, on to my review.  I had a chance to preview this camera at my local Costco and compared it to other similar products.  I wound up going with this camera mainly because I liked how fast the shutter was taking pictures and the price point at which I bought it outdid the competition.  I purchased this for a trip to southeast Asia, where it is summer over there this time of year and VERY sunny.  I won't lie - this camera takes some getting used to with the different modes.  For instance, the all inclusive "intelligent mode" is different than the "superior mode" and learning the quirks of each takes a bit of time and practice to see what works best in your particular scenario given we do not have the option to choose ISO settings with these cheap digital cameras.My overall impressions: the video this camera takes is awesome.  I mean it's as good as or better than a camcorder.  The button wheel to select your picture mode is kind of annoying compared to a canon or nikon, where everything is painted on the top of the wheel and you can just move it to the desired location.  So yea, it takes an extra couple seconds to rotate the wheel on the Sony DSC to get to the correct picture mode you're looking for.Picture quality: Overall the colors come out very nice, again depending if you choose the proper picture mode to fit the situation.  Case in point, in low light during a sunrise with a little cloud cover.. the "intelligent mode" will make the background appear brighter than it really is vs. the superior mode which will more accurately reflect the color tone, however it may be too dark for your taste.  Some experimentation is required for those who want the best quality photos.  It will take good pictures regardless, but experimentation with the different modes can turn a good picture into a great picture.I'll try to post some of my photos with this camera for you to view and make your own decision.  One point of warning: this camera sometimes cannot accurately record dark reds very well.  A lot of times, I found certain red colors like a red rose would turn out more tomato colored red than deep red.  Those are really my only downsides to this camera: red tone can be off and you may need to experiment with the settings wheel to get the best pictures possible out of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: extreme0120
Reviews.Content: I'm not going into detail about this camera because there are other reviews here that have plenty to say about this unit. What I do want to say is that I am EXTREMELY picky when it comes to image quality, options, price, longevity, cosmetics, etc. This camera is built extremely well for how cheap it is. There are tons of options that keep me happy. The image quality is superb, and the video is even so! I actually wasn't expecting such good video quality, and the audio is astounding as well (I'm an audiophile). For the price, by far and away this is the clear choice. I used to dislike being the camera guy with my old cameras only because I know the quality of the picture didn't match the performance of my shots - well now they do! I just recently took a photo, blew it up to poster size 24x36 and it looks stunning! MUST BUY!

Reviews.Title: I don't love it.
Reviews.Author: Retired and Happy
Reviews.Content: I replaced a Canon Elph because it was taking a very long time between pictures.  However, it had a viewfinder as well as the screen.  I could not find a small camera to replace it that had both.  When it is very bright outside you cannot tell what you are taking a picture of - you just hope for the best.  In addition, this camera seems to have a problem with the on/off switch.  Sometimes the camera starts quickly, sometimes slowly and sometimes not at all.  I sent it back to Sony in Texas and they supposedly fixed it but it still has the same problem.  Pictures are generally okay.  Next camera will be another Canon.

Reviews.Title: Met my expectations for a small camera
Reviews.Author: javaphin
Reviews.Content: I had a trip to Europe planned and at the last minute, I decided it might be nice to have a small camera to stuff in a pocket. I had the older version of the Sony Cybershot, but it was bulky and didn't fit well into my back pocket. So I expressed order this version of the CyberShot.I took hundreds of pictures and not always in the most ideal conditions (rain, cold, umbrella, crowds, etc), and it worked great. The battery life was great though I did tend to turn it off after the photo op.My only complaint is I had to take my glove off to turn the camera on:-).

Reviews.Title: The lens is bad
Reviews.Author: A. Govyadinov "Alex G"
Reviews.Content: I used a sony cybershot for 7 years, was very happy with the superb quality. When it finally quited, I bought this one. At first it was fine, tons of nice features: my favorites are the pop colors and watercolors. But the more we used it the more we noticed strange baloon-like-head portraits. I think this is the spherical aberration of the lens, which is incredibly bad with this camera. I am shocked, always favored sony G-lenses. I wish I could return it, but I think it is too late.Do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous!
Reviews.Author: ChrissieJ
Reviews.Content: I adore this camera!  It doesn't hurt that I got a fabulous deal here on Amazon either! ;)  Great photos, even in low light.  The 10x zoom is a treat, especially since my previous camera only had 3x.  I don't think I can ever go less than 10 again.  The camera is small enough to fit in my pocket or a purse pocket. I carry it around everywhere.  I bought a great little silver "necklace" that attaches to the wrist strap slot and had this hanging from my neck while in Iceland.  Also, 5 days in Iceland, the battery never ran out.  I know this is now last year's model, but if you can find it for a decent price, go for it!

Reviews.Title: Good cam for the price.
Reviews.Author: Justin Wade Bonaparte
Reviews.Content: Good looking cam. I got it as a carry around for pics and videos of the kids, travel, etc. I shoot primarily with DSLRs.Images are good, not great. Color saturation is nice. The noise reduction leaves your images looking a little strange, kind of smudgy, at least if you're used to DSLR output. Videos look good, but haven't played with that much.

Reviews.Title: A Fine sub compact Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: D. E. John
Reviews.Content: The Sony Cybershot DSC-WX150 is just what it claims to be: a very small, no frills point and shoot camera that takes really good photos and videos and is easy and fast to use.  Don't expect a lot of complicated dials and choices to make.  If you want that look at the DSLRs.  This little guy easily slips into a shirt pocket and is always ready for those times that seem to only occur when you don't have a camera.  Now there can be no excuse for not carrying a camera.  And, on top of all that, you can take panorama shots which the camera automatically stitches together for you.  That's something even my big cameras don't do.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Small Size; Large Features
Reviews.Author: D. Paul "Gadget Junkie Lady"
Reviews.Content: Growing weary and tired of lugging my DSLR camera around, I began searching for a point and shoot camera that was easy to use, intuitive and didn't require expert-level understanding of words like "aperture" and "shutter speed" to yield great pictures. In terms of features, I wanted a camera that takes decent pictures indoors and in low light situations, shoots fast enough to capture my 8 year old and offers the ability to take panoramic shots and HD videos. This camera offers it all. After several weeks of researching, I finally settled on the Sony Cybershot DSC WX150. This camera offers everything I wanted in a very small size. I've used it in several different settings and it's been excellent.The only "con" that I can think of is the buttons are really small, so if you have large fingers, this camera may be extremely frustrating to use. Also, because of it's size, I would imagine that it may be easy to lose.

Reviews.Title: Just the Thing
Reviews.Author: pportion
Reviews.Content: Did my research and concluded that this would be best replacement for old, broken camera.  Wanted a point-and-shoot that just took good pictures and was easy to use.  This fits the bill exactly. It looks like it has many features and adjustments to improve the picture quality, but I'm not oriented in that direction, so I just use it as it is and I'm fine with it.

Reviews.Title: Made me viral on youtube !
Reviews.Author: K.M
Reviews.Content: One of the best cameras I have every have had the pleasure to own and use hands down made me viral !I was very far away from Rihanna, but this camera made me look professional the clarity is the best sony hands down ! I will never buy another brand ever![...]

Reviews.Title: I like it, but.......
Reviews.Author: Ryan K
Reviews.Content: I really, really like this camera. Super fast turn on, WONDERFUL low light shooting. The digital zoom was ridiculously clear. But the battery door didn't sit flush with the camera and I felt like it was going to snag on something and break off. I contacted Sony, and they advised a return. I sent it back, but will be buying another with the hopes that this was just a manufacturing fluke. Will leave another feedback when the new one comes in. Great camera, but I can't have something in and out of my pocket that may break off at any time.edit*** I wanted to edit this as I finally got a new WX150. I returned the original purchase and picked up another WX150 off site. The new one does not have the same battery door issue that the first one had. So this camera is looking like a good buy, as long as you know that the QA may not be superb on these and you may have to send it in for a replacement. But the images coming off at least inside the house in artificial lighting are spot on.Getting into manual mode takes a few extra steps than with my previous P&S;, but if you know you will be shooting manual instead of auto, then you can have the setup tailored beforehand.Still can't believe how well the digital zoom comes out. Looks just as good as the optical zoom. Unheard of.

Reviews.Title: Not good a good camera
Reviews.Author: Shawn Johnson
Reviews.Content: A first I liked this camera but that started to change the battery life did not last long the pictures where great at first but they did take a lot of memory up. Some cool effects where fun to play with. You can not zoom at all it looks really bad. The shutter speed is really really slow, you wait a very long time to take a new picture. When taking pictures of kids dont let them move they look really bad too. After a few shots every picture stared to look bad. I would say really dont waste your time or money on this one.

Reviews.Title: love sony cameras
Reviews.Author: sharon
Reviews.Content: This is stylish, easy to use, look great and is compact enough to go anywhere.  i have tried several different brand but alway come back to Sony.

Reviews.Title: all very well and very fast excellent
Reviews.Author: ramon
Reviews.Content: all very well and very fast excellent I recommend all you world I love very much my product I'm enjoying it to the fullest thanks friend

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures.  Easy To Use.
Reviews.Author: C. Festavan
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures.  We got it because my Canon Powershot was too difficult for my wife to take impromptu pictures with.  This was the perfect camera for her.It has many preset settings, but she keeps it on one setting all the time.  The shots are nearly as good or as good as the shots from the Powershot with me selecting just the right settings.It is small.  It has a great zoom.  And, it is easy to use.The first charge lasted about month with moderate use.Update:  The optical zoom on this camera does indeed work during movie recording.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Gloria G. Agee
Reviews.Content: I had to do a ton of research prior to choosing a camera...... about wore me out.  Everything pointed to this one being the best for the money.  Mid range cost with BIG features!  LOVE how lightweight it is and all it can do!

Reviews.Title: mostly satisfied
Reviews.Author: Denizhan Yilmaz
Reviews.Content: I love the camera. It's tiny to carry around and very practical to use. also the image quality is quite good. I'm an amateur who takes photos on the vacations or special days therefore I was looking for something fast. It's not as fast as I have expected. But still good for the money.

Reviews.Title: Recommend
Reviews.Author: SometimesBuyer
Reviews.Content: I got some great pictures from my trip with this camera and had a lot of people comment on the quality of my pictures. The only downside...and this may be more of a user error thing...is that action shots are hard to take...but keep in mind that I'm still figuring out the camera. I am also not a fan of the "night feature" which always gave me pictures with light streaks running through them. Other than that I am really pleased with my purchase and would recommend this camera. Happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tiny Camera
Reviews.Author: Waqar A. Nadeem
Reviews.Content: That's the camera you like, great pictures and awesome features. Only problem is the you cannot use the regular SD and micro SD cards.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: William R. Miller
Reviews.Content: This camera is really capable, can do many things - it has not been easy for me to learn to use it.  There really isn't an instruction book, either online or printed, just some quick tips and a menu system.

Reviews.Title: mother in law loves it
Reviews.Author: John K Su
Reviews.Content: nice ultra compact camera with a decent size zoom which is what my mother in law wanted. i was leaning towards a canon or panasonic for her but was impressed by the solid build quality and features of the camera. grandma's no photo geek, purely point and shoot for trips, grandkids and she loves it

Reviews.Title: Fun Camera!
Reviews.Author: canusee menow
Reviews.Content: You get a a lot of modern technology in a tiny package and at a really reasonable price (price changes very frequently ... hint hint)I have been able to make some excellent macro stills and WoW macro movies that turned out amazing! Got a new hobby too, editing movies which has been enjoyable. The zoom strength was a surprise, "it's like a spy camera" my friend said. I agree with other reviewers who fault this camera for blurring things like distant forests, some of these photos do look a bit water-color like. It does make some excellent images as well, keep shooting to find it's sweet spots! I have played around with the 3D functions and created some photos in stereo pairs and red/blue Freeware here: [...] In camera 3D panorama it a fun gimmick be sure to try that out. Well worth the price, we're benefiting from a competitive camera market. My first Sony camera was HUGE it used floppy disks, and cost 3X more, it just keeps getting better!

Reviews.Title: excellent picture quality for a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: A. Inman
Reviews.Content: I like the compact shape, the lens quality, and the fact that you can charge via a cord rather than needing a separate charger. I like that the menu lets you choose a black or a white display for settings screens (or even pink). It comes with a lot of annoying sound effects turned on, but there is a way to turn these off in settings, thank goodness. I've only used this a few times so far, so I hope it will hold up over time. My previous Sony did, so I'm optimistic.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber Shot WX150 18.2 MP
Reviews.Author: jonoknee
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a wonderful camera. with lots of options with it for a small camera. I usually shoot with a larger Professional 35 mm digital camera and wanted something smaller but still powerful with lots of options when your out and about and want something smaller, and this camera does just that ! Thanks Sony.... Great Camera !!01/23/2013Jonoknee

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-WX150Small & compact
Reviews.Author: Philip Gambino
Reviews.Content: Small & compact, takes great stills & movies. Great in low light situations. Large viewing sreen helps to focus on subjects

Reviews.Title: Great Pocket Camera w/sharp Zoom Lens
Reviews.Author: Peter Von Nessi "Ebook Reader"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for the money. Unfortunately, Sony has discontinued some of its original colors like red & blue. The camera is simplicity itself, small enough to fit into a shirt pocket with ease, to always be available for that instant shot. The lens offers a very sharp 25mm to 250mm zoom (35mm equiv); great macro focusing; very fast general focusing; a very bright LCD rear screen; auto and a number of preset settings for semi-auto use. This is a camera ideal for use when you need photos, but don't want or have the time to fiddle with settings. I use this unit for appraisal work where I can set it on one of two auto settings and concentrate on taking the picture and not the camera. The only weak point is flash output. It is fine for use in most indoor room situations, but falls short in much larger settings. However, you can compensate by using a slow shutter flash setting to capture more ambient light.Overall a good buy. I bought three of them, some to give as gifts.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Henrikson
Reviews.Content: I just received our new family camera this afternoon and all I can say is, WOW!  Picture taking is already much easier than with our old camera (that thankfully, accidentally was thrown out with the Christmas trash).  No more big delays to take photos, no more missing the shot (and with 4 young kids there are a lot of shots), no more futzing with the flash, no more changing out the batteries every 30 minutes.  Just pure family photo and video taking bliss!  I will admit that taking photos is loud, but so are my kids so who really cares?  Survey says: A+.  Thanks Sony!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Little camera for the price!!
Reviews.Author: Darren O'Hooligan "Darren O'Hooligan"
Reviews.Content: First off, I don't usually review products without thoroughly testing them out first. It's been only a week, and I can't believe how well this little camera performs. I purchased this camera after my son broke my Nikon s6100 which I didn't care for all that much. Took great pictures outdoors and in well lit areas, but forget about low light situations. I've owned a d70s, and currently own a d7000. After using the s6300, and reading reviews on the new 6300/9300/6400 no way would I ever go back to a Nikon P&S.; After doing some heavy research and reading reviews I narrowed it down to 3 cameras: The Sony DSC-W150, the Panasonic sz7, and the canon sx260. Other Cameras Included the Nikon s6300, s9300, and a canon elph I can't remember the model #. I really wanted to go back to Nikon but After all my research and reading, this is what i ended up with. Keep in mind that I had an older Sony P&S; and HATED it, to this day it still works, and even my 7 year old son wont use it. I was reluctant to go with Sony as well, however for the price I got this camera at, and after reading all the reviews I pulled the trigger.  I purchased it the night before a trip to Disneyland. This is a good test for me as I get to shoot in day and night, and Disneyland Has all kinds of great architecture as well and bright vivid colors to shoot. Everything from little props to the shops, to the characters, Disneyland has it all. From the second you press the button, this little camera starts up very quick. No fancy logo at start up, just press the power button and start shooting. The first test was basic shooting, rides, buildings etc. What immediately amazed me was how quick the camera fired. There is very little shutter lag to begin with. Shutter lag was the first reason I stopped using my last Sony. I missed so many shots, and going to the Nikon was a breath of fresh air. This one puts the nikon to shame. As time goes on, technology continues to improve and this camera is no exception with it's impressive shutter lag (oxymoron). As with most point and shoot cameras it did, at times, take an extra second to focus at full zoom. This is my first 18mp P&S; camera and It does take some time to record a shot with that much info and a file that big. You definitely need to be patient when shooting when it comes to processing and recording images. The camera came with a class 4 card, and I did put one of my class 10 cards in and it did seem to slightly decrease the time to process and record and image. (I haven't had a chance to use the multi bust shot yet). Then there's the panorama sweep mode. Instead of taking multiple pictures and use a program to stitch the pictures, you press record and you have a few seconds to record a panorama. Again only a short period of use with this feature but so far pretty cool. There are scene modes aplenty here, everything from night portrait, low light no flash, pet mode, soft skin.. etc. There's tons of in camera editing options as well. Now you can't adjust shutter speed and aperture, but to be honest here, that's not quite what a P&S; camera is for. With all the scene options and in camera editing options being able to choose my shutter and f-stop aren't high on my priority list. If i wanted that much control I'd take my D7000 with me. What really impressed me was the intelligent scene mode recognition. No matter what the situation, the pictures came out perfect. I was pleasantly surprised with the sharpness and colors of the pictures. Each picture no matter what the scene, came out spectacular. The colors, the focus, not dull or not over saturated.Now for the bad. This camera is VERY VERY lightweight. This is bad and good. It's bad because it feels awkward in my hands, and in most people's opinion, the lightweight body will give the impression that it's not built well. Because it's so light, it was a little hard to keep steady at full zoom, however it does have image stabilization to compensate. The menus are not very intuitive at all. AS a matter of fact, I did some things that I thought would take me back, or to the next item I needed, and It was all messed up and had to start over. The buttons are again a little intuitive and the more playing the more confused I was. The one thing I do like is that switching from picture mode to movie mode to panorama is a slider which is nice because on my old Nikon a slight press of the movie button and you recorded a movie. As mentioned earlier, processing takes some time but again, get used to it, and you'll love this camera.I can't wait to play around with all the in camera editing and in camera effects this camera has to offer. But up to now, This camera is a perfect combination of great features and great picture quality, wrapped up in a lightweight body. While it doesn't give you the opportunity to control the shutter and Aperture, you won't need it, it takes great pictures all on it's own!

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: M. A. Engelke
Reviews.Content: First, you should understand that I suck at taking pictures. Honestly, I think every picture I've ever taken has been off center and out of focus.  Not so with this camera!  I've had a great time playing with all the extra features, though I doubt I'll ever use them in every day camera use. I wanted to be able to point and shoot great pictures, and that's exactly what I got.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Sean M.
Reviews.Content: For the past few years, I've been using my iphone (4G) camera to capture all my memories. I really like the convenience of the smartphone cameras, but the quality is just terrible, especially if you try to blow up the photos. I did a good amount of research on a nice compact camera that would take great photos with a price range of $150-250. The Sonry Cybershot DSC-WX150 is really a spectacular camera. It is super light and easily fits in a pocket. The flash is great and the night shots come out really well (this was a huge factor for me). The pictures in good lighting come out well as expected (any camera should be able to pull off daylight shots without problem). My only gripe with the camera is that you have to keep the camera really still when you're taking a photo, as even a small amount of movement will make the picture slightly blurry. Other than this, though, an amazing camera for the money. Would buy it again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Takes nice pictures
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace my 8 yr old Fuji point and shoot. I like the compact design and the various picture settings. I am able to take very nice pictures even in low light.  My only complaint so far is that even on the anti-blur settings, I still get blurry shots if there's a lot of motion, which isn't ideal when you have a small child. However, I'm still learning how to use this camera (it's very different from my old camera), so it could be user error.

Reviews.Title: I love it.
Reviews.Author: Dixie Aldridge
Reviews.Content: Love that I can charge the battery.  Love it that the flash does not have to charge and I can capture photos quickly, instead of missing the shot because the flash is too slow.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: KCHAWK
Reviews.Content: I have an HX200, which is also an 18mp Sony, but a super zoom model.  This little guy does almost as well and is a lot less expensive.  This is great as a pocket camera and fits in my wife's purse, I bought it for her.  I like the pics and in good light it is really great.  The intelligent plus setting gives you a chance to get a picture in almost any situation.  I won't write a huge review, there are plenty of in depth reviews.Con: The little clip that holds the battery in seems flimsy.Overall:  A great camera for a snap shooter.Update:  The more I use it the more I like it.  Pay attention to white balance and use flash indoors.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC- WX150
Reviews.Author: Patrick J. Shields
Reviews.Content: Fabulous camera, terrific service, fast shipping.  Who can ask for more?I was looking and researching for my next camera which I determined would be a sub-compact pocket style point and shoot.Read many, many articles on line comparing various cameras that seemed to fit my needs but this Sony came out a winner for me.  Compact - yes, basically simple to use - yes, excellent photos - yes, adaptable in varying situations with minimal adjustments - yes.I've been kind of a photo buff for 50 years, for time even had the larger than life SLRs, but I don't need or want photographic equipment to obtain the results i am looking for now.  I feel that the SLR's of 50 years ago were a struggle to produce the quality of photos we can get from our simple-to-use point and shoots cameras now.  And they really are NOT simple cameras - with amazing electronic technology inside, all the hard and time consuming work is done for you - they are simple for us to use.Sony is world renown for making top quality photographic equipment and the DSC-WX150 ooozes that quality everywhere.If you want a terrific point and shoot camera, look no further than this one.  And, Amazon has THE best prices as usual.

Reviews.Title: Compact, reliable, and well-engineered
Reviews.Author: Frank Bridge
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera for a recent trip abroad.  It worked in extreme climatic conditions (-22F),but it was exposed to that environment for only about 10 minutes at a time.  I loved the way the camera automatically changed modes with the conditions (e.g., from standard view, to macro when dealing with extreme close-ups, to landscape, etc.).  I won't bother with the manual settings, as the camera does its thing with no additional help from me.The video also worked well, particularly the image-stabilization feature.  I was able to take great videos from a moving vehicle.On the down side (all of which are minor quibbles)----The zoom is slow to activate, and once it does start, the lens zooms in rapidly.  It works better when zooming out, but my videos are full of excessive zoom-in shots followed quickly by zooming out.--The 1.0X zoom level is very wide angle, and I often found that it was necessary to zoom to properly compose the shot.--I did not like Sony's license terms for their software, and I read these documents thoroughly before downloading software.  In particular, Sony demands that they have open and automatic access to one's computer to update and change their software without letting the user know. I didn't load their software because of this language.--The mode change wheel on the back is clumsy to use, but fortunately I have little need to move out of their automatic mode.  Others who want to change these settings may feel differently.--Once I had mounted the camera as a hard drive on my desktop computer, I could not get eject it.  The error message was that the Generic Volume couldn't be stopped.  So I had to shut down my computer before disconnecting the camera.  This problem may be attributable to my old machine (2002, Windows XP, but patched up to date). Your mileage may vary.--Once I transferred the videos to my hard drive, their .mts format would not play on my computer.  Again, the problem is likely to be my old hardware.  However, I downloaded a video conversation utility package, and it crashed as well.  I had hoped to convert these videos to .avi files.--The Sony batteries have 50% of the capacity of the generic Wasabi batteries (also purchased through Amazon).  One Sony battery was more expensive than two Wasabi batteries and their charger.  So I recommend the Wasabi hands-down compared to the Sony.I also recommend purchasing two memory cards.  Although 32 GB allows for over 5,000 .jpg photos at the default resolution, at about $26.00 per chip, it is wise to have a spare.

Reviews.Title: pretty cool little camera for anytime shooting. Point and click
Reviews.Author: BigD "BigD"
Reviews.Content: Many other reviewers have said a lot about this camera- so I bought it...they were right- it is a VERY FAST and GOOD camera for the price.  I have used 10 different cameras in the past - SLR's etc.,  This one has so much in such a small package though.  Not having to make sure you have 2 or 4 lenses you want ...etc., You can not use in water without a housing though..but it is not made for it like others are.  But posting pics from parties or gatherings or even just shooting the sun setting is easy.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber-shot best Camera
Reviews.Author: SterlionCreationscom
Reviews.Content: its a real good camera with nice and interesting features compact small and thin great for all kinds of shots indoor and outdoor etc

Reviews.Title: Small, easy to carry for quick shots
Reviews.Author: chill
Reviews.Content: Lots of features: especially like the long 10x zoom.  Color and clarity poor in low like conditions, but the High Def makes great short movies to view on TV and wide angle is super for large group shots.  If traveling, be sure to get an extra battery and external battery charger.  Lots of control over shots and the "in camera" guide helps when you are getting used to all the adjustments.  So far, it seems to be best kept in the "p" auto mode for quick grab and go shots.

Reviews.Title: Ex- Canon User
Reviews.Author: D. Doyle "Irene"
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent for the price!It is way better then the Canon camera's I was buying.This camera takes very sharp images.I love it because it takes great photos of my toddler in action, with my canon, pictures never came out well unless he was posing for several seconds.If you do not know how to use all the buttons, the "easy" feature is great because you do not have to worry about settings.

Reviews.Title: I did my research this time.
Reviews.Author: Jordan Wilking
Reviews.Content: My last camera, a Nikon Coolpix s9100, was aesthetically appealing. Maybe a little large, but that never bothered me. What did bother me was that it took a fairly long amount of time to focus. When it had finished inwardly reflecting and gathered the courage to take a picture, it gave me a blurry mess. Not all of the time, but enough to make me look foolish with my incessant "Wait. Let's try that again." There was this brief, half-second window before the picture was taken in which the stars would align and everything would be clear; however, my camera chose to be obscure. Perhaps taken by an artistic whim, I couldn't get much cooperation from it.This camera, however, is much more agreeable. It can be turned on and ready to go within 2 seconds and you can have a clear picture a second later. I'm satisfied with how it deals with low light.The flash works really well, but sans flash is appealing as well though there is noise, as expected. After the picture is taken, there is a brief wait (maybe a second or two) for the picture to show up on the screen, but I'd rather than a delay during the picture-taking process.I haven't messed with the video too much but, from my little experience, it looks great.A couple other things of note: (1) I don't usually care too much for special effect, but I thing the "Illustration" effect is pretty cool. It makes everything look as if it was drawn. (2) The two auto-focus settings may be all you need. They pick the right setting (e.g. Macro, night, etc...) and they do so seamlessly. (3) The camera is a good size for shirt pockets. You can tell somethings in the pocket, but it's not too bulgy.Just my few pieces of input to aid your search.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Ismaira Rivera
Reviews.Content: Excellent. Take beautiful pictures. It easy to use. The battery resist a lot of time. A recomend it a lot

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: for the money your getting a deal but if your prone to dropping slim objects just have a wrist rope to make sure you cant drop it anyways this thing takes video in 1080pi so its freakin packed with great editing tools and ways to make great shots hope you enjoy. totally worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great little point-and-shoot for under $200
Reviews.Author: ChuckS
Reviews.Content: While there are many point-and-shoots in or under this price range, this little gem takes beautiful hi-res photos and the movies that it takes are very high definition as well at 1080p. The movies it takes are particularly worth noting. The anti-shake is awesome and I can zoom in and out without noticeable shake. I highly recommend. I am an amateur photographer.

Reviews.Title: Giddy up already!
Reviews.Author: RumPunch
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE PERFECT LITTLE CAMERA!  Takes awesome pictures, battery life is excellent, and it is so light that you forget that it is even in your pocket.  I call it "The perfect shot" since I have not taken a bad picture with this thing.  It's truly a "go anywhere" Camera.  I took it to Carnival on the island of Grenada, then to Panama, and Costa Rica.  Need I say more? OK, well I own A Rebel DSLR, but this Little SONY is great for those once in a lifetime shots, like when you are out to dinner, or at a party, or those I 'hafta' get this, or even those ooh! ooh! let's take a picture moments.

Reviews.Title: VERY NICE
Reviews.Author: Randy C. Finch
Reviews.Content: I have owned several small Sony point-and-shoot cameras. W80, W150, WX1, WX10, and now the WX150. The WX150 is the smallest and lightest of them all. I am very pleased with the image quality given the small sensor and the high pixel count. I was confused when the PMB software could not detect my videos on the SD card, but once I installed the newer software, PlayMemories Home, everything worked just fine. One suggestion for improvement. PlayMemories Home can only detect videos when the camera is connected to the computer, not when the SD card is inserted into a card reader. It would be nice if the latter was possible.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the size and price.
Reviews.Author: David W. Lewis
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a few weeks ago for a trip we were taking to Europe.  I own a higher end Canon digitial SLR, but didn't want to carry it while doing the tourist walking thing.  I wanted a small, light, compact camera that I could keep on my belt in the case I purchased for it.  I've taken an average of about 80 photos a day with it.  I've been very impressed with the photos it produces.  I've taken photos in all types of lighting conditions, from a moving train, from a moving boat, moving car, etc., and the pictures have all been great.  I've also been surprised at how long the battery has lasted.  I've been able to go several days without recharging the battery.  I purchased two spare batteries thinking I'd need more than one a day, but haven't needed them.  I also purchased three 16gb SD Cards for it, but one card will hold over 2000 photos at high resolution so that will likely be all I'll need to use.I read the reviews on Amazon before I purchased it, and bought it based on the reviews.  I bought it at a local store, not Amazon, that had a 90 day return policy.  I figured I could return it if it didn't work out.  I'll be keeping this little jewel.

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: My Sony cyber-shot 18.2MP camera is by far the best little camera I have ever purchased. The pictures come out very sharp and detailed. Its very fast and comes with all the features I had wanted. I highly recommend it. Thanks Sony!

Reviews.Title: Great Photos and Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Englewood Amazon Lover
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera whiz, however, I know a great picture when I see it.  This camera is amazing!  Great photos and easy to use.  The instructions for every feature is right on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Good all-around camera
Reviews.Author: RRB
Reviews.Content: This camera is a big improvement over my old one - it is fast, has easy video, a good optical zoom and a practical insertable SD memory. A good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Sony WX150
Reviews.Author: CathyK
Reviews.Content: Received this camera about a month ago and couldn't be happier with it.  The quality of the pictures is fantastic and the features such as painting and watercolors is unbelievable.  I love the compact size which makes it so easy to carry with you; not like some of the bulky ones I've had.  I also purchased the battery adapter and 2 extra batteries from Wasi.  Battery life is good. I highly recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: real easy to use
Reviews.Author: Radio44
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for my wife who is not tech savvy. Set it on auto everything and let the camera do the work. No need to look for the right settings, it does it all for you. I am sure there are better cameras out there for those that have it as a serious hobby. But for us, it is a point and shoot. The panorama feature is real easy and super cool to use. The camera is smaller than most, but after handling it for a while, you forget and it is easy to throw in your pocket or purse. So far... we love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Sony Cyber shot
Reviews.Author: Peter Gosch
Reviews.Content: The small door to close and hold the battery/memory stick will not stay shut.  I only used it on one trip and now I have to take it in to get it repaired.

Reviews.Title: focusing problems
Reviews.Author: J. Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: It has nice qualities but I have problem with focusing on daylight, at intermediate distances, pictures can not be focused ,

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Sukru Tikves
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera, beyond my expectations for the little thing. Of course it cannot compete with DSLRs, but Sony seems to have understood that, and implemented features more important for family trips, and quick shoots.My first impression was the camera is real fast. It seems to have a newer image processor inside, and has the  the fastest capture speed I have seen so far. Even doing advanced stuff, like high quality panoramas, with post-processing effects enabled, it performed very well. This was a nice little surprise.It comes with a great array of features. As mentioned above, it can shoot good panorama pictures with minimal effort, can shoot in 3D (only for a 3D TV), do automated shots with smile/face detection, can track/zoom a target in video, send pictures through wifi (though this requires a third party add-on), shoot video in Full HD resolution, and can do all of these with ease and great speed.Overall, I'm really impressed with device. And I like that Sony places a small internal memory inside, so if the card is out, you can still shoot a few pictures. The zoom is acceptable -- of course even with image stabilizer you cannot get very sharp pictures with 10x zoom, then you can choose not to go that far and it works well. And the menus are easy to use.I would definitely recommend this camera for non-professionals. It's easy to use, packs a lot of features, and shoots good enough pictures.

Reviews.Title: What a great little camera
Reviews.Author: Jerry Helsing "jlhelsing"
Reviews.Content: My wife is a camera snob and until now only used her Nikon DSLR for taking photos.  Her reasoning is that it takes a better photo, has a better response time, and has better zooming capabilities.  I on the other hand, am not that picky because I am not taking photos for National Geographic so I like the convenience of a little point and shoot camera.  Well, my Canon point and shoot was starting to get old and when I saw this available to me, I snatched it up.  It is great! VERY fast response time for taking a photo, it allows for a 180 degree panoramic photo, video is pretty good and my photos look, at least to me, as good as her DSLR.  Well, she took it from me to play with it to see what I was making all the fuss over and she was amazed at how nice it was.  So much so, that she kept it as a "just in case camera."  One thing I do want to mention though is that you will want a nice size memory card in this because at 18.2 MP, it takes up a lot of space.

Reviews.Title: Another great Sony camera
Reviews.Author: Cecilia Yao
Reviews.Content: I've been always happy with Sony's camera and I only had Sony's camera since my very first one. Not that I did not try other brands, they just have never been appealing to me.My last camera (Sony) was bought in 2006, it was dropped so many times and really beat-up but never stop working. Just an amazing little robust camera. I guess Sony does not make much money out of me for keeping this camera more than 6 years.Early this year, I was bored while waiting my flight at airport in Tokyo, then I saw the new Sony camera that were so cool (comparing my old 6-year old camera). This is the seed sony planted in for me, I started doing research on camera and eventually decided to buy this one.Long story short, I am very happy with this camera so far. It makes beautiful photo and very intelligent control by selecting right scheme for me. Its compact and light weighted that fit perfectly in my pocket. The memory interface is compatible with my old SD card and I could even use the same battery charger from my old camera.I highly recommend this camera for people who enjoy small/compact camera with good photo quality and rely on auto-mode frequently.

Reviews.Title: Nice compact camera
Reviews.Author: Jody B-D
Reviews.Content: Gave this camera as a gift to a friend who is all thumbs. He loves this little model and he uses it all the time. The photos are crisp with nice color. Easy to use for even a big guy and very compact. Made a nice gift.

Reviews.Title: Not my Favorite Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: D. Oppenheim
Reviews.Content: This camera is OK but I think I like the Canon point and shoot cameras better. This camera seems to be built sturdy, it's easy to use, it powers up quickly, and the photos seems sharp when just reviewing them at the size of a computer screen. I also is very compact and some of the photo features are fun. What really bothers me about this camera is how heavily processed-looking it makes the images. My Canon cameras do not do that. Also, this is not as user friendly when I hook it up to my camera. Rather than Just simply plugging it in to my windows 7 machine and opening a folder full of my photos, Sony seems to interfere and make it not as simple. Photo transfer seems slower, and it saves all of my photos as read-only, so I have to go in and manually un-check read-only. That or use the Sony program to transfer photos which really irritates me. I wanted to like this camera but the processed looking images and the issues with transferring photos were enough to make me get rid of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and blurry.
Reviews.Author: GeekParent
Reviews.Content: I bought this in April 2013 from J&R; on sale for $150 to replace my 8MP Canon Powershot Digital Elph. With light and careful use, by June 1st the battery cover would not close completely, leaving a small gap on the corner. It was too late to return, and I couldn't go without a camera for important events so put off returning it. In middle of July it would not recharge. The plug for the battery is on the bottom, without any cover to protect it. Despite the many settings I still cannot get a really crisp photo of my children if they move at all or in bright sun. There is always significant blur/wash of details in landscape and people. It does take very nice fireworks pics, stills, and movies, but for this price I expected better. I would recommend you not waste so much money and get the Nikon Coolpix 6300 for almost $200 less.

Reviews.Title: yo
Reviews.Author: juan carlos
Reviews.Content: que es buenisimo el imagene es nitidorecomiendo a mi primome gustacalificacion muy buenale gustado a la familia

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot that delivers consistent results
Reviews.Author: Gauron
Reviews.Content: Blazing fast camera, outperforms my Lumix FZ35 in almost all respects. Better contrast and saturation than my FZ35 and produces much better background detail and clarity and handles skin tones better than most point and shoots out there. Zoom is great, usable during video but digital zoom is useless despite what sony says. The camera itself is gorgeous and the USB charging is useful. The filters are cool and (when it works), the background defocus produces pics that look professional.Why 4 stars?  Two things, 1) The battery is a joke, it always dies quickly and more importantly 2)The amount of noise that a 18MP sensor produces is frightening (its much worse than my FZ35 -which I though was too noisy) However, this is only visible when you zoom in or crop the picture. But isn't this the reason for a high megapixel count -the ability to crop without loss of quality!  You also notice when you zoom in that the compression on the images is very high - sharp detailed pictures start to look like oil paintings!Dont get scared if you are just uploading pics to facebook or just trying to capture the moment. This high performing camera will not fail you. However if you are a pixel-peeper like me, avoid this purchase for a camera with a lower megapixel count and/or larger max aperture.

Reviews.Title: is it user error or the camera?
Reviews.Author: sonybalony "sonybalony"
Reviews.Content: My last camera, a Canon, couldn't take a bad shot, no matter who was driving.  But this camera is very touchy.  Many more photos are blurry, too much or not enough of something.  I want my old camera, but it broke.  :-(

Reviews.Title: Mac friendly, feature filled camera
Reviews.Author: O. Workshops "Godzilla"
Reviews.Content: Replaces a 2008 version of Sony Cyber-shot.  Low light performance vastly superior to previous.  HD 1080 function is of amazing quality for this low price - even in low light and while varying zoom.  Blur suppression seems to work well.  Even the pan feature works as described.  HD display through HDMI cable (buy separately) to a Sony television in incredible quality - plug and play simplicity.  Size is smaller, weight is lighter than previous model.  Mac computer recognized immediately.

Reviews.Title: not so good
Reviews.Author: muh
Reviews.Content: I owned a old DSC (3.2 mp, made in Jpana) and it is very good and happy with a until it was fell down and broke (used 10 years).then bought this and after 1 year it stopped working, and sony.ca repaled with another one (ha, it was also refurbished not new !!!).I have also some Sony stuff such as YV, DVD player, CD player, walman....in my opinion: if it is made in Japan (or Maysia), the quality is good, if made in China hahahahah, hard to say something .avoid made in China

Reviews.Title: It's good .
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: It works, it's simple, it's good.  I don't have to put batteries in it, which makes it great! . .

Reviews.Title: What a find!
Reviews.Author: Thomas J. Alizio
Reviews.Content: This was purchased to replace a similar Sony that we had for a few tears and did not survive several "drops."  The first camera was for my wife to have a point and shoot experience and not have to work with my more complicated camera.  Guess what - I got hooked on that one, and this replacement is fantastic.  In the past 2 years we have been to National Parks in the U.S., spent 2 weeks in France and basically now have it with us all the time. We are totally impressed with the clarity and color of the pictures and the camera's versatility.  We could not use flash in many of the museums and inside chateaus in France, but the clarity, brightness and color rendition in the pictures were fantastic and its modest zoom really made a difference on may occasions.  The movie feature works beautifully.  Overall, this is a great camera for the price.  Invest in a 2nd battery and a high capacity card  and you have all you will need for almost all your photography needs.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Digital Camera!
Reviews.Author: Zurab Pirtskhalaishvili
Reviews.Content: I really liked it when it first arrived. It takes very sharp images, has a 'SONY' colors and what I like most is that it's fast. It is very good in taking full HD videos, I've done even short films with it. Best thing for amateur mobile photographers, beginner film-makers, tourists and families.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera at great price
Reviews.Author: tricia
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. It takes sharp pictures and is easy to use. I have had it over a year and still love it. I'd buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera! Just the right size to fit in ...
Reviews.Author: Walter
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera !  Just the right size to fit in a cargo pocket and it takes excellent photos.  Have taken it all over the world and no problems.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: PatrimonioSeb-Irodden
Reviews.Content: I am using this camera to keep memories of our family trips. We went to Europe and when I asked to other hotel guests to take a picture of the family, they frequently asked: Where did you buy this beautiful camera?. It's very little (light) and very thin, but the picture quality is superb. I used to carry a Panasonic with me at least 5 years ago, but I decided to change when I read about the capabilities of this cybershot. My favorite? You can choose which is the best picture of a round of automatic shoots and you can have HD recording if you like to keep most funny moments of family encounters and dinners. Great perfect camera for this purpose.

Reviews.Title: Family Snapshots Review
Reviews.Author: Sarah "Fall in Love Every Day"
Reviews.Content: I'm no camera wiz, lets just get that out of the way up front.  Personally, I'm not a big fan of this camera.  I had a SC DSC-W730 prior to this and it was my favorite camera I had owned.  I go through digital camera's every couple years or so.  I'll admit, I'm hard on my cameras.  I'm around children a lot and I let them take pictures, inevitably the camera gets dropped...I throw my cameras in my purse at times and generally, I treat them as a functional daily item without tons of reverence.  My SC DSC-W730 lasted the longest of my digital cameras (almost 4 years) and until the last month of it's life every picture I took was beautiful.  Action shots, still shots, the photos were amazing.  I decided not to get the same camera because this version (SC DSC-WX150) had a higher zoom and that drew me in.  The zoom is pretty substantial, and for what I use it for it does it's job.  What I am NOT a fan of is this camera's ability to handle action shots.  I want to rip my hair out.  I have a 3yo child and before that (with my old camera) I babysat for a family of four children.  I know what to expect with (amateur!) action shots involving kids.  This camera does not give me beautiful, clear, first-time-photo shots.  I'm lucky when I get an action shot with this baby.  I'm still pining for my old Sony Cybershot.  For the price I think you can find better.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: John F "Louis J Ford"
Reviews.Content: I am well pleased with this tiny but full-featured camera. Multiple settings allow wide range of pictures under almost any condition. Zoom works well and camera very easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Not good battery.
Reviews.Author: ross of pt.roberts
Reviews.Content: camera is okay, but the battery (included with purchase) stopped working just after the one-year warranty ran out...and I don't take a lot of pictures...

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Hashu Deikus
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome! I love the picture quality and the features are great. I've had it for a couple of years now and I still love it. I bought my mom a newer model of this camera for Christmas and she loves hers too. I have a DSLR as well but this little point and shoot is much easy to grab on the go just in case I want to take a few pictures. The picture quality is fantastic, the zoom is really impressive and the newer model has WiFi capabilities. It's very easy to use, I highly recommend this camera!Update: This camera has been treated like a baby, covered from weather, kept in case and used with care throughout it's entire life. After reading other reviews regarding a dust problem, I figured I could beat the odds, not so much. A little more than a year later, it now has a speck of dust on the sensor that cannot be cleaned by a professional camera shop. It shows up in EVERY picture in any level of zoom. Sony told me that for $91 plus taxes I can have it repaired because it's out of warranty. I'm not going to pay more than it's worth now to have it cleaned, so it's pretty much a useless camera that still has the ability to take beautiful pictures if cleaned. It's sad, I loved using this camera for everything, now it just sits on the shelf and I have gone back to my old faithful DSLR.Another update: After much contemplation regarding potentially damaging the camera, I used a vacuum on it and tada! The dust is gone! Perfect pictures again! Once again, I am thrilled with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Shawneepaints
Reviews.Content: I was happy with this purchase, although I agree with what other users have stated.  It is a bit challenging to learn to use the camera, which didn't pose as much a problem for me since I only needed a few basic functions and learned them quickly enough to serve my purposes.  I am not a fan of the way the functions are made available.  Too hard to get to one from another, but the camera does take really nice photos, is light and compact.  It contains some great functions if you want to take the time to learn how to manage them and have patience when using.

Reviews.Title: In between the typical cheap digitals and high end DSLRs
Reviews.Author: GregoryDearth
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera used. After doing a lot of shopping around, I found that there were two options and price ranges. You either get a highly complicated, bulky full size digital SLR, starting around $450 and going way way up in price, or you get a sub-standard light weight 16 mega-pixel or less camera for $170 or less.This camera is very unique. It sort of bridges the gap between the two. While you certainly cannot change the lense, it has many other features found in high-end full size digital SLRs while having a lightweight and ease of use closer to the lower digital cameras. It also has an 18.2 Mega pixel sensor, which is a few higher than your typical cameras of its price range and still costs less than $200 brand new.It lets you decide what kind of camera you want it to behave like. You can actually put it into 'easy' mode, in which the camera does all the thinking for you and works as fast and with higher image quality to your cell phone camera. But if you are doing some complicated shots, you have a HUGE variety of options.It has scene modes, where the camera adopts specific settings depending on what you are trying to shoot. It has a pet mode for example that makes great photos of your pets. It has a snowy outdoors mode, which makes shooting a ski-trip quite easy and effortless. You can even capture fireworks in its specific mode. There are about a dozen different scene modes.It also has a "P" mode which roughly equates to how an SLR would work. You can set the exposure and various other settings manually. You can even have it adopt various ISO's, simulating different types of film, which adjusts the sensitivity. This camera thereby performs incredibly well in low light.Finally, there are intelligent modes that adjust the various settings on the fly. I took a picture of an owl in a tree at night using one of these modes and the camera automatically took two pictures based on refocusing on the flash.The focusing mechanism is incredibly smart. It has properties typically seen in the big DSLRs like object tracking. You can have it target a particular object and if that object moves in the frame (or you move the camera), the focus square stays glued on the object. The focusing mechanism also has a mode whereby it recognizes the overall shape of a central object and attempts to focus on the average of that shape. For example, if you have a guitar in the picture, it will create a boxed shape around the guitar and make a good focus on the whole object.It even shoots photos in 3D, which is really really rare in cheaper digital cameras. You need a 3D tv to view the pictures and an HDMI cable to connect the two.The video capabilities are quite impressive. Not only does it shoot in 1080p, but it has a stereo microphone on the top of the camera. This makes all the difference in the world when shooting action. If someone is running across the field of view, you not only see them moving across the video in beautiful HD, but you hear their feet stomping from one side to the other, adding excellent realism to the recording.If you don't need 1080p you can shoot at lower levels. This is great for shooting relatively unimportant stuff for posting on websites as it makes the videos much smaller in file size while still looking great on smaller screens.The 10x zoom is a little slow to engage. But it works quite well and is an actual optical zoom. This means what you see is not going to be all pixelated when you zoom in on it. This works well when shooting distant objects.I purchased mine used from a pawn shop and the camera looks like it is brand new. The body is a light aluminum, and it feels remarkably solid while being quite light weight.So before you slap down half a grand on a big DSLR, ask yourself if you really are ready to deal with the complexity, expense, and weight of such cameras. And before you consider a lesser camera, check its mega pixels, 3D capability (really fun to use), stereo audio recording capability, and if it is just another plastic rectangle with minimal settings flexibility.

Reviews.Title: Better than my last overpriced crappy camera, but not the best
Reviews.Author: K W
Reviews.Content: This camera works fine, however I am really disappointed that within a year of use (and careful storage when not in use), it has fibers or something inside the lens. So frustrating. My last camera (different brand) had the same issue quickly, and I had to buy this one. It doesn't seem to affect most pictures, unless it is something very solidly plain or white. The other issues I have are that I have to avoid using the flash like crazy because it makes a shadow behind the objects/people that I am photographing, no matter how close or far I am from them. Yuck. Also, it appears that the lens causes a shadow in the corner of some pictures, which is irritating. I've taken hundreds of pictures in the last few weeks as I work on a big project, and I do like this camera for ease of use, however I haven't yet been able to really play around with a lot of the extra settings. It drives me nuts that cameras don't come with paper manuals anymore, as when I'm taking pictures I'm out and about and don't want to be strapped to a computer to look at the manual to change settings. This camera is good enough and I hope to not have to replace it soon (someone in a big box store told me, when I searched for my previous camera, that cameras are made to last 2 years or less, which is ridiculous. I had my first digital camera for 6 years before it just stopped working and I was forced to replace it, unhappily. I refuse to spend $200+ on a new camera every 2-or-less years, and I expect them to be higher quality if that's the expectation of the companies who are taking all this money.)

Reviews.Title: not worth the $$$$
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: S  L  O  W to take the picture---my daughter could age from it! Not worth the effort. I did not think it was an improvement for the same model a few years older.

Reviews.Title: Worst pocket camera I've ever had
Reviews.Author: T. Nofziger "Tyler Traveler"
Reviews.Content: I've had probably 4-5 small pocket cams over the years to compliment my Canon DSLR's and cannot believe how terrible the shots are from this camera.  Indoor shots are basically impossible.  Everything turns out grainy and blurry.  I'm not sure if I should give up pocket cameras all together or try again with a different model or brand.  The positive reviews on here absolutely shock me.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Chuang7662
Reviews.Content: Good quality picture, easy to use. The night light picture not what I expected. But still worth to by at that price range.

Reviews.Title: When it's good, it's great
Reviews.Author: T. Linker
Reviews.Content: You can produce some surprisingly fine photos with this lightweight camera.  It's much faster than I expected, and works well for a number of purposes.  If you want snapshots of friends, tourist sights, even landscapes, you may enjoy this camera.It is not a replacement for a more serious camera, however.  I own two Nikon semi-pro DSLRs, which are heavy but give incredible control over a picture and elegant color rendering.  If you need to shoot wildlife in a forest, birds on the wing, or anything that requires clear control of the focus, this camera will disappoint completely for the simple reason that it has no viewfinder or manual focus control.  And an LCD screen outside in bright light is VERY difficult to see.It does quite well choosing the focus point when the subject is simple, and especially if a human face or a building is the subject.Unless your smartphone has a really high megapixel count, this camera will probably outperform it.  And it has a large number of scene types to choose from ( if you can figure out the menus), for everything from bouncy pets to night scenes and fireworks.I've been a little disappointed with flash pictures using this, but it does quite well without flash in fairly low available light.The video function on this is also quite usable.

Reviews.Title: Best camera EVER!
Reviews.Author: Linda H.
Reviews.Content: I went on a photo shoot yesterday with a friend and he used a pricey Nikon D3100 and I used the Cyer-shot.  I just downloaded the pics and you cannot tell the difference in the pics!  I love it!  I scuba dive and may get the housing for underwater shots it's so good!

Reviews.Title: Best Camera every
Reviews.Author: angie
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, it take wonderful pictures and is so small and compact. My son took the camera to Italy and was not dissapointed with the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Best camera
Reviews.Author: KJ
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera. The pictures are so good, that a family member used the photos of artwork to post on a site that sold his paintings. The site uses these photos to sell prints of the artwork.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, inconsistent controls layout.
Reviews.Author: Frank Mason "Dristal"
Reviews.Content: The conundrum is great performance. Total inconsistency with controls layout model to model. That shows poor communications internally within their organization. Poor ergonomics is not fresh marketing and innovation. They should benchmark and get a clue.

Reviews.Title: Sharp pictures but otherwise disappointing
Reviews.Author: CK "CK"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an Olympus that was no longer focusing properly based on consumer website reviews.  I'm mostly disappointed with this camera.  1) It's never downloaded properly.  I put the software on my computer and I get an error message every time on my camera.  It eventually will download if I ignore the message.  The software also has no editing capability.  I end up still using my Olympus software for that.  2)  The settings are almost impossible to figure out.  Especially when you are in the middle of shooting and need to make an adjustment.  There is no way to over-ride the settings and put it on manual.  My Olympus had manual settings; this doesn't.  Just to turn the flash off requires going to the menu to try to find it every time.  The settings are not intuitive or easy to find.  3) There are only two pixel adjustments that I can find: 3 mpx and much higher.  The choices for size of photo are just not there.  4) Sometimes it takes multiple shots, sometimes not.  I don't know how or when this feature comes on.  5) Camera did not come with a manual; it's on-line.  Not a help when you are using the camera and need to figure something out.The camera has a very good lens and takes a nice picture.  Otherwise, I would not choose this camera again.  If you want only a point and shoot for family photos it may be a decent choice, but don't expect any cropping or editing help with this software.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: SailingShelley
Reviews.Content: This camera has become a well travelled companion! It also does great shots for anything else you may have in mind. It is as simple or complicated as you demand! It's light and easy to slip into your pocket or purse.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures although response time could be better.  Wife loves it so I guess that's what counts.  I would recommend to anyone trying to take pictures in non-sport or fast moving conditions (unless the fast moving stuff is in bright sunlight).

Reviews.Title: Was worried about price but love the camera
Reviews.Author: Daniele Bryson
Reviews.Content: I usually use my smartphone for pictures and videos but purchased this camera for our trip to Disney World.  I was so glad I did as the quality is much better than what I get from my phone.  Very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Ok for snapshots I guess, but I'm not impressed.
Reviews.Author: Catharine B.
Reviews.Content: I was expecting too much from such a small camera. My iPhone is easier to operate and has much better quality.

Reviews.Title: WARNING Sony & Distributor do not stand by the product
Reviews.Author: Laurie Reinbolt
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend that you do not buy this camera as the manufacture and the distributor DO NOT stand by their product. I purchased this camera in March 2013 and by November 2013 the screen stopped working. I contacted the distributor and they told me there was nothing they could do for me and I should contact Sony. I contacted Sony and they told me the camera was not covered under the 1 year warranty (will contact me later to tell me why, could not tell me) and the repairs would cost $460 dollars (the original cost of the camera was around $180. I will update this posting once I hear back from Sony, however I have not had a good experience thus far. Do not waste your time or money with a company or a distributor that will not stand by their product.

Reviews.Title: Quite fragile
Reviews.Author: YouReview
Reviews.Content: Fairly quickly, the rotating wheel for making settings changes became quite touchy. If I tried to make a change, it would flicker between multiple options even when I wasn't touching the wheel  Often it would take a couple of minutes to make a simple change.Unfortunately I dropped my wx150 a short ways.  Even though it was protected inside a hard shell case, it now can only create fuzzy pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with a disappointment
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my husband for Christmas last year.  He has always liked it, but in the past month it has become evident there is a problem with the connection port for the battery charger and USB cord for uploading to computer.  Something seems to be broken in this port--no charging, the computer doesn't recognize the USB connection so you cannot upload photos.  Too bad it's 1 month beyond the warranty period.

Reviews.Title: Video files NOT compatible with Mac
Reviews.Author: Walter Koval
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera with a lot of power and easy to use. Very good picture quality, etc. BUT the video files are NOT compatible with Apple/Mac. Took me forever to figure out what the issue was, and the issue is inherent within the device. womp womp.

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera
Reviews.Author: studentdjh
Reviews.Content: Takes great point and shoot photos. Very user friendly and easy to customize settings. Small and compact for easy storage and travel. Battery life is somewhat short (3-4 hours) but if you make sure to let it completely charge every time right before using it it'll last a little longer.

Reviews.Title: Decent, but not great camera with mediocore macro for a point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: B-Rad
Reviews.Content: I got this for my fiance to catalog the places we go and the flowers and wildlife we encounter. I looked at reviews and saw good things about the macro mode, something necessary for decent flower photos. We have not had the same experience even after fiddling with the settings and trying many different techniques. It takes decent photos, but I was taking much higher quality pictures with a Lumix in the same price range I was using for work. The menus are convoluted as well.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I've had!
Reviews.Author: PennyForYourThoughts
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera for about a year now and I LOVE IT!  It is the best digital camera I've had to date!  The pictures are great, the zoom quality is amazing, and I love that you can video and capture still pictures at the same time.
